(I've been to other hotels in SF and had much bigger rooms). - it's quite pricey for what it offers, I mean, nothing is included and rooms are claustrophobic. -Last day we had to print our flight booking and they wouldn't allow us to print as they didn;t have a PC for guests. it was kind of an emergency and after soooo long they have printed it for us BUT we had to PAY for each sheet of paper printed. i found this disappointing as in exceptional circumstances, they should have helped as they could. Overall, you can find hotels with bigger rooms but if you like a modern and quicky feeling, being in the centre of the city, this is for you. Just go with the right expectations!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, but I Question Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: mcal3K
Reviews.Content: Nice location right across the street from the Gates of China Town (corner of Grant and Bush). Also there are a couple of lovely "alleys" nearby that have been converted to French-style rues--like cafe-lined narrow streets in Paris. Still, there is lots of traffic outside and the rooms can be noisy late at night. Very friendly and helpful staff. Excellent in that regard. And there's free coffee offered in the lobby during morning hours (7:30 to 9:30, I think.) The rooms, though, were just OK. In fact, our "king eco suite" seemed a bit like a budget room as far as size, decor, and bathroom. You had to move aside to close the bathroom door and be able to use the toilet. There was no way to swing the door shut without a careful maneuver--it was that cramped. The tired shag carpet wasn't appealing, but the bed was definitely comfortable. The old-fashioned window air-conditioner didn't quite cut it in terms of efficiency or looks. And I was told that this room was an upgrade . . . So--I question the value per dollar. For $250ish I felt the room was too expensive. I've stayed there during off season for much less, and I won't choose this hotel again unless there is a price incentive.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Place With a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LA-Italia
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for business. The rooms are small, but in very good shape. Everything was very clean, and nice amenities. Very helpful staff. The location is great: right across from the entrance to China Town. Easy walk to tons of restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “2nd stay great”
Reviews.Author: Pchips
Reviews.Content: This was the second annual trip in February. The staff remembered us, they honoured a free breakfast I won in a draw from the year before. The morning coffee and the late afternoon wine is a treat ( cookies in the afternoon are nice to). The room was a little tired but comfortable, we asked for a quiter room then the year before and lo and behold it was quiter. Rates are great in Feb, a little too high in the summer, too bad as we liked it. I must add that the location is the best. 10-15m walk to North Beach, 8m to Bart, close to great restaurants and Embarcadero, I am sure if we return in Feb we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel with lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: 123sunseeker
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights, decor was really cool and was greeted at check in with freshly baked cookies. Had the corner room which was a little noisy but made up for with the great view. Bed was really comfy also got starbucks breakfast included in price. Would really recommend this hotel for friendliness, price and somewhere unusual to stay.

Reviews.Title: “dont go for zen room”
Reviews.Author: daisymay08
Reviews.Content: We had booked a zen room at the triton, we did not know it was a futon that was put against the wall, ok for young ones but hopeless and impossible to get into or sleep in for 65 plus. Be careful. Hotel clean and in a good position with free coffe in the morning but take heed ,ask for large room and pay extra if you want to be comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and fun”
Reviews.Author: lemstar
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Jerry Garcia suite for two nights. We are in our 50s, and used to be Dead fans; my husband played in a band that played all Dead stuff when we were young, so this was kind of cool for us. The staff was very pelasant, always around, and helpful. The room was a large hotel room, by normal standards. The decor was Garcia-ish, with fabrics like his ties, and his paintings all over the walls. One wall bore his original signature, with a photo of him sitting in the room above it. There was a large couch, but no "cocktail" table, or end table. The TV swiveled to face either the couch or the bed. The bed was comfortable. There was a small desk and chair as well, and a countertop with coffeemaker and mugs. The shower was kind of sprinkly--showers are so important, and so overlooked--I couldn't wait to shower at home after our stay, with a good strong spray. As a member of JDV (you shoudl join!), we got free internet. We did pay for parking. We often stay in chains. Maybe I should say used to stay in chains. Of course, we traveled without kids this time, and I think chains can be good when you need connecting rooms. This was a funky cool hotel, and we liked it very much. It wasn't cheap to stay in the suite, and I don't htink I would like a room that is 110 sq ft, but we really liked our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “retro pop culture in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Robandwilson
Reviews.Content: Much like all other reviews, I cannot speak highly enough of the staff; they were extremely friendly and helpful! . The lobby and public areas are fantastically decorated. Our room, it was pretty compact, but very well laid out, it had everything we needed and was very cute the pop culture theme was quite refreshing, Happy hour with FREE wine tasting, What more could you want, Great Location Check Funky Decor Check Clean Check Helpful and freindly Staff Check They are even pet friendly only down side was the internet was $6.95 for 15mins oh well nothing can be perfect I would recommend to others for short stays to the city

Reviews.Title: “meh”
Reviews.Author: mikaln
Reviews.Content: Maybe this was cutting edge in 1991 when it opened, but it's tired and dowdy now. Small rooms, not even an extra chair. The first room they put me in opened onto an air shaft. When I requested an outside room, they said it'd be $25 a night more. It was a slightly nicer room, still small. On the plus side, the location is great if you want to be near Chinatown, the Financial District and the galleries & shopping in and around Union Square. The people who run the place are generally very nice and helpful (although they didn't make the wake-up call I requested!). The wine hour in the evening is nice, but not unusual; a lot of hotels do that. Unless you get a really good deal, there are better options in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “It was great...til I encountered the bed bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Clyststmary
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Kimptons before and when I come to SF i usually stay at the Palomar. As this was Pride weekend and I figured it would be pretty hectic on Market St, I went with the Triton instead. It's a great location right by the gate to Chinatown and an easy walk to the BART. I was given a king room and yes it was small but nice and even on the second floor the noise wasn't bad at all. I stayed two nights and during the first I could swear something was in bed with me. And sure enough in the morning there were bites. But as I'd been out at Fisherman's Wharf the previous evening I thought maybe it was mosquitoes. Last night however, I wasnt feeling well so I was in bed by 8. And within a couple of hours, I had loads of bites on my arms and legs and even my face. I went to reception and asked to move and as soon as I showed them the bites, they not only moved me, but moved me to a king suite. Great, if I wasn't now paranoid about bed bugs! I know SF is known for having a bed bug problem but I was really disappointed that even the Triton had them. That the receptionist didn't seemed shock at all is also really disappointing. In the morning when I checked out, a different receptionist commented on how few people tell them when they see bed bugs. Sorry, but that's not really much of an excuse for having them and not keeping your rooms clean! I will be contacting Kimpton as I think they need to totally fumigate not only that room but probably the whole hotel! Oh and maybe train the staff to not dismiss your bites as mosquito bites - that didn't sit well with me. So overall, a great location and fair service but until they fix the cleanliness problems I won't be staying there again or any other Kimpton. Shame really.

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed”
Reviews.Author: NZJodi77
Reviews.Content: Three of us stayed at Hotel Triton on a 2 day stop over in San Francisco. Much like all other reviews, I cannot speak highly enough of the staff; they were extremely friendly and helpful! We arrived mid-morning and it was no problem to check in early (at no extra charge). The lobby and public areas are fantastically decorated. We were a little bit disappointed with our room, it was pretty compact, in fact the bathroom was so small, the sink was outside! I think had I was probably comparing our room to those that are featured on the website; this was somewhat more 'standard'. Overall though, we had everything we needed and the location of the hotel was great and I would recommend to others for short stays to the city.

Reviews.Title: “it is all about service”
Reviews.Author: travler180
Reviews.Content: It was the first time we stay in this hotel. At first, we were excited about the hotel because there were good reviews. We checked in with the front desk, and she told us we were getting 2 worst rooms in the hotel. She spoke with an attitude and said it's because we booked through priceline and how much we paid for the room. We had requested 2 rooms to be on the same floor previously on the phone and they said they would do their best. However, She assigned our rooms on 2 different floors , one on top of the other because they were the worst room on each floor. Once we walked into both room and realized both were very small and dark about 10'x10' bed room with a full size bed in the corner right against 2 walls. We had 3 adults and 2 small kids in this trip. In the room even 1 adult and 1 kid can barely fit on the bed. My mother-in law is 75 year old, and she could barely move around the room. I asked to up grade to a king size bed room, but they could only switch us on the next day. The hotel was old and need major up grade. The conventional AC was also old and very loud. On the other hand,the staffs were friendly, except the lady who served us when we checked in. The best of the hotel was the location. It was one block away from the China Town entrance and close by many hot spots. We are not picky with any hotel because we are normally out visiting most of time . We think We will come back again because most of the people were friendly and helpful. one thing we will suggest to the hotel is to increase their price on priceline. Also, If you accept the price, you should receive your guest the same way no matter how much they pay for the room or you don't take them. We paid $100 per room per night for 2 rooms and 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel, Tiny Room, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: cyntia
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Triton. No noise problems, clean and well-run. Located in a pretty street close to the China Town gate, we could walk to most places (we don't mind a climb) we visited, from Quoit Tower to Union Square shopping, SF MOMA, cable car stops, North Beach for dinner, and Grace Cathedral. Hotel was small and we had a double-double for three adults (we're a couple with a college age child). One complaint was how strong the room smelled, of some unpleasant cleaning products. Maybe this was due to the Triton being a "pet friendly" hotel. Nice staff, free wine on arrival, and the helpful and informative front desk were all big pluses. Loved the cafe next door, good for breakfast or a quick drink. Our main complaint was that the room was extremely tight, not enough space for suitcases, small in-room sink squeezed in by the door, tiny bathroom with barely enough wiggle room to shut the door behind you before sitting on the toilet. Maybe we had an unusually small room - might be worth a call to the hotel esp if you're a party of three. But even with just two of us, it would have been a tight fit.

Reviews.Title: “Crazy but cool”
Reviews.Author: Birdyseyeview
Reviews.Content: Loved it. The hotel has a great location near Union Square and on the border of China Town. The wacky design inside won't be to everyones taste - but I liked it, and certainly provides a talking point with the lobby staff. The reception staff were chatty and helpful, and the concierge were keen to help us find our way around. The room was quite small but very well appointed - the animal printed bath robes were what sold the hotel to me! Just a touch different from the very usual and very boring white fluffy robes. Free tea and coffee in the lobby, wine in the evening, occasional tarot readings, and green apples every day! I would definitely go back - it has everything I needed and at a very reasonable price too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place--would stay again for sure”
Reviews.Author: MiamiLuvtotravel
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel using miles and was a little nervous but as soon as we walked in the door I felt at home. The staff was friendly and very helpful with all the questions we had. Everybody made an effort to speak to you personally and great you each time they saw you. The hotel was clean and offered many ways to be social (wine and cheese, ice cream social, etc...). The location was perfect...right across from the Chinatown gate and close to public transportation. Just a short walk to great breakfast joints as well. The room we had was very small but clean and an effort was made to put all that would be needed in it. The beds were very comfortable as well. It was a wonderful stay and our whole family commented that they wanted to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service but overall an ok hotel-would not go back”
Reviews.Author: beachloverandfoodie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling to San Francisco and decided to Priceline a hotel room and we ended up with Hotel Triton. After reading the mixed reviews online I wasn't sure what to think but we typically aren't very picky so I was excited about our trip. Upon arrival they were very rude to us and told us that because we booked through Priceline instead of through them that they couldn't do a whole lot for us. Aparantly they have small rooms described on their website as "perfect for the solo traveler" that have a small full bed. I had signed up for Kimpton's rewards program to get free WIFI and I asked if we could at least get upgraded to a king room because I was a memeber and they wanted to charge me $15 more per day....there was no way my husband and I would sleep comfortably together on a full bed. After 10 minutes of arguing and getting lectured about Priceline, they finally conceeded and gave us the upgrade for free. Call me crazy but if you were going to do that why not just do it in the first place and make everyone happier....this review would have been glowing but instead they made their first impression on us a very negative one. Other than that, the stay was nice. Clean room, the front desk people were mostly friendly after that. Only thing I would suggest is to bring ear plugs if you want to sleep in because the hotel is in a great location but because of that there is a ton of street noise. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annabelle2904
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to stay. Although our room was small it was serviceable and well furnished. Great flat screen tv and a nice bathroom. The air-con kept it lovely and toasty too. The bed was comfy and there was no irritating outside noises. It is walking distance to many San Francisco attractions and the Happy Hour every day on the foyer is an added bonus. I am a Kimpton member (it is free to join online) so I had free internet wifi while I was there.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: hixy10
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The staff were great with our young children (3 & 5) - leaving gifts every now and again. They gave a away free ice cream to the kids. Also complimentary wine to guests every evening. Room was very clean but it was small (the only negative really). Location is great...right outside the entrance to China town and a block away from Union Square and all the big label stores (inc. Macys). If we're ever in San Fran again we'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fatastic stay at the Triton”
Reviews.Author: luckytravels66
Reviews.Content: Since we booked on Priceline, we were not expecting much. Boy were we wrong in this case! My husband brought me to the City for the weekend to see Hugh Jackman (surprise!!) for Mother's Day. Our stay at the Triton made our trip even more special. The first room we received had a very small bed, which would not do, as we are both nearly 6' tall. My husband called the front desk and was instantly given a room with a King bed. The room was awesome, with a great view. We loved sitting in the big chairs near the window to people watch, and the staff was awesome. We travel to SF quite a bit because our daughter is in college there, and we will visit this hotel again and again, with or without Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: krazykev
Reviews.Content: Ivestayed in 4 other San Fran hotels and this was the one i loved most.Stayed for four nights -contacted them before a long international flight- they were able to get me a room early- fantastic reception staff very friendly hotel in great location - the great rate i got from expedia also helped. Comfy quiet room very funky decore -although my friends complained they had a lot of street noise. Breakfast next door at the cafe was nice, irish pub around the corner was great but very busy - will definatly stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, getting ready for a refurb!”
Reviews.Author: SB1509
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for something different from the standard San Francisco room this is a great place to stay. Right outside the China town Gates and within a few blocks of Union Square. The rooms are brightly decorated to say the least but look a good few years old. Everything is very clean and in good working condition you just get the feeling looking at the now faded textiles this place was much more fun when it was first decorated. The staff are more than helpful but pleasantly in the back ground. Overall if i was to return to San Francisco The Triton would definitely be on my list of looks for a hotel even if just for the location and reasonable costs. Maybe if i return in a year or two i will see the hotel in all its glory!!

Reviews.Title: “very cool place, great location”
Reviews.Author: Clevelandrocks07
Reviews.Content: This is a very unique hotel, right at the edge of Chinatown. The staff is very helpful, with great restaurant recommendations, quickly providing any extras we needed. The daily happy hour is nice, they went out of their way to get something for my kids. Just a warning, it is small. The room (we had a double-double) was tight, with a sink in the room outside the bathroom. The lobby is also pretty small, but there is plenty of space to hang out (I stayed down there in front of the fire after the kids went to bed). However we had no problems with the size of the room, unless you are entertaining it is fine for sleeping and dressing. If you do have kids, we heard there was a dog in the lobby. In reality he belongs to one bellman, who is not there all the time. After three days we saw the dog once, which disappointed our kids a little. Overall it is in a very convenient location, we could get to public transportation to just about anywhere in a few blocks. Definitely would recommend it for a family if you want a cheaper alternative to the pricier high end hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Chic”
Reviews.Author: Deror
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very chic and stylish. The lobby is magnificent in its eclectic styling â€“ I loved the rubber ducks that floated in the pool at the front of the hotel. There is wine tasting every afternoon, and coffee and tea in the morning (but no breakfast â€“ for an excellent breakfast â€“ try the CafÃ© de la Presse next door). The hotel is located across from the china town gate, and within walking distance from Union Square, and the BART railway system. The room is medium size, and the bathroom is nice, but not big.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quite funky, needs an update”
Reviews.Author: GilesNelson
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 2 nights between different legs of a business trip. I wanted something different and "boutique". I confess I was upgraded to a suite which had a lot of nice features and furniture. The reception is quite cool and is funky without being tacky. The staff were helpful at all times. Generally though, the hotel needs an update. It feels like this was last done maybe 20 years ago and although the reception feels modern, the rooms do not in many ways. Many of the fittings are just rather tired. It's a great concept though - so please Triton, get some investment in, shut yourself down for 6 months and come back as a modern reincarnation!

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel - great location!”
Reviews.Author: razgurl
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for a weekend in the city. The location was very convenient - lots of things within walking distance. The staff was friendly and helpful with suggestions. Only suggestion is to bring earplugs since the neighborhood can be noisy at night - small price to pay for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Three star hotel, good neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: AlexandriaGirl123
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at this hotel in early March. This is not the typical four star Kimpton property I have become used to in other cities. This is definitely a three star hotel. The hotel retains some of the nicer options that four star Kimpton properties have such as free wine happy hour every day from 5 to 6pm and free coffee and tea every morning. The location is perfect and most attractions can be explored by foot from the hotel. Things I did not like included a small room and an even smaller bathroom. Two people cannot be in the bathroom at the same time and the door has to be closed in order to use the toilet. The building has a "funky" smell that comes along with old buildings. I did not have a problem with the cleaning service but I was annoyed that the maid would refold the used towels and move them so we would not know which towel was mine and which one was my husband's. The beds are comfortable. The rooms do have ugly air conditioner units. The view from the room was an alley so I did not waste too much time admiring it. Overall, this is a decent hotel in a great neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous, overpriced and not comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Antoine_K_10
Reviews.Content: Rooms are the smalles I have seen in the US (even in Europe they'd be small). Sink is outside the room, between closet and tv, not inside bathroom. Matrasses are quite old and not comfortable. We were in one of the highest floors and even there we were able to hear lots of noise from the street all night long because windows are not acoustically sealed. We also had the bad luck of being right in font of the elevator door, and could hear people talking in the hallway. Windows had no curtains, only blinds, which did not close properly, so lots of light through all night and of course at first hour in the morning. Bathroom was claustrofobic, and even little details, where they could improve, like toilet paper, were not taken care of: paper was of the lowest quality and so thin! Closet was ridiculosly small, forget about storing anything. Dogs everywhere and odd smells all over the place. Front desk staff kind of helpful but not really, like they don't care at all about the customers but they say they do. We asked for a late ckech out on a Sunday afternoon, and you know what they said? "You can stay one more hour free of charge. Otherwise we'll charge half the room". The difference between checking out at noon or at one is none. Colour schemes and lighting were erratic and out of date. Furniture and decoration is old and looks cheap and sometimes in bad taste. I found this hotel to be totally ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “I wish I had a positive experience in this hotel (honestly)”
Reviews.Author: godh
Reviews.Content: I planned to stay there an entire week and just couldn't.... I must say the staff was super friendly... they made me lot of favors, always had a smile on their face... I got a room in front of the Ice Room - too bad, I woke up in the middle of the nigth because the machine was noisy noisy... I arrived on Sat, bad since I wanted to sleep and there was music all around the bars outside... (add the police car sound) No towels until day #2.... I found pieces of chips in the floor, I asked my room to be vaccum..and they did it... Since day # 1 I noticed the bathroom was not clean a all (hair in the tub), so I asked the staff to deeply clean it... they did it, but this time the hair got stuck in the tub hole... so it wasn't clean at all :( You can hear the people walking in the halls... the floor sounds a lot when you walk... Ayayai! I wish I can recommend this hotel... but this is a BIG NO for those who like clean, well-maintained hotels... When things are dirty you never know!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, great service and location”
Reviews.Author: RichardHHarris
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for 5 star - look elsewhere. This is a midrange hotel. Bed was comfortable, bathroom was good, decor is OK and funky in places, gym is OK, but price, location and service were great! Friendly helpful staff and prime city location on the edge of China Town made for a perfect stay. Great Sushi at Mikaju just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: UKTraveller075
Reviews.Content: On arrival the staff were very friendly and helpful. The decor in the lobby is great, very different to anywhere we have stayed before. We stayed in the Zen den room, which was quite small however this did not matter as we did not spend a lot of time in the room. The hotel is well located at the gate to Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location. Room is very small and no view.”
Reviews.Author: marciopin
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Union Square, this is a nice place to stay. The free wifi is very slow. The room is small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, Friendly, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JDincalif
Reviews.Content: On a "we got to get away" weekend we chose to stay at another Kimpton hotel in San Francisco. Our first impression was that of the great mural wrapping the walls of the lobby. Bright colors with amorphous designs depicting the history of San Francisco's beat, hippie, cool and cosmopolitan history and cultures. The hotel is on Grant Avenue near the city's Chinatown Gate. Good restaurant and shopping are just steps away from the hotel's big double (and heavy) double front doors. Wine and juices are served each afternoon between 5 and 6. Because Kimpton's is a pet friendly hotel chain we were entertained during the happy hour by the antics of the bell man's well behaved pet dog. Vintage movies and classic MTV videos play on the lobby's big TV screens and as soon as we walked in the hotel the vibes were set for an entertaining and fun experience. After taking the light show motif elevator to our floor the experience calms down to to reflect a more conventional older, but well kept up property. The hallways are painted in subdued colors while the hall carpeting gives thought to a wild Las Vegas casino style pattern. Sounds like a culture clash so far but believe me the designs seem to work. Our room was small but every amenity was provided. One wall was a deep red and the other three walls were painted robin's egg blue. Hotel room colors never interested me before but with this hotel chain I have learned to look for the unusual in decor. The rooms main lighting fixture was a three pronged, three color globes or orbs. I won't try to elaborate further. Service was great. Location is right down town. The room rate was very reasonable for the quality of the experience and for the location. Although we here on an entertainment only basis the hotel is just a short walking distance to the city's financial center, and a weekday morning shuttle service is provided from the Triton to the financial district. Anything negative? OK, because there are water flow devices on the bathroom fixtures the toilets run slow and the water pressure is a little low. But geeze they provide leopard patterned bath robes - so what do you want? Will we return for another visit? We need to see what the lighting fixtures in the other rooms look like! You bet we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even better customer service”
Reviews.Author: blueangelrugby
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised during my stay at Hotel Triton. The location of the hotel is wonderful, within easy walking distance of Union Square, great shopping and restaurants, and the cable car lines and it's in a decidedly "not sketchy" part of town. What stood out even more was the customer service - the young staff was absurdly attentive and friendly and always greeted us with a smile. They were helpful with directions, the minibar, and even gave us an extended checkout time. The room itself was small (even by San Francisco standards) but very clean and had all the amenities one would need for a weekend trip. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel, such a funky hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Racha1
Reviews.Content: I loved my stay at this hotel. it was awesome. It had sucha cool lobby, that you got a great feel as soon as you walked into the place. The rooms were a little small, but very clean and tidy with a reasonably sized bathroom The free drinks from 5-6pm were awesome and a great way to meet fellow travellers. There was also tea and coffee in the morning and free hot chocloate of an afternoon. The hotels location was great, right near China town and close to all the great shopping Hotel staff were very friendly and halpful with directions, pleaces to see and recommened great places to eat and to go out

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: LoveCalifornia1313
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. It was a great location to shopping, public trasportation, even walking distance to many places. The staff was very friendly and very helpful. Our door guy, Evan, was very knowledgable and helpful about anything you needed to know.We love the wine hour they had every evening. It was a chance to try great regional wines, and chat with others.The room was what we expected from the website, not fancy but very nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great fun, only drawback window unit a/c”
Reviews.Author: MoonRiverRoundhead
Reviews.Content: Our room : faced the street, not the alley Pros: very hospitable staff funky fun decor hotel provided leopard robe, great price through kimpton intouch offer ($99) cookies, wine reception, etc. GREAT location Cons: window unit a/c or heat, aka "the window shaker" Expensive parking (but no more than all downtown SF hotels) Room is small Summary, had a great time and would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Just great”
Reviews.Author: Gammal_Ost
Reviews.Content: Hi, what shal I add to all the other reviews? The hotel is located spot-on in the heart of town. The staff is great and the hotel extraordinary. Would go there again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fun decor”
Reviews.Author: coratraveler
Reviews.Content: What I liked the most about this hotel was its unique style/decor and great location. The hotel is surrounded by wonderful restaurants, cafes, bars, and shopping and is only a few blocks from the metro. You pretty much walk outside and find yourself in the center of it all. I felt very safe walking around at night. I was very pleased with how quiet the room was - no noise at all from the street below (although I was on the 7th floor) and couldn't hear anything from the hallway or other rooms (Quiet is very important to me). Another plus were the Aveda toiletries. Pros: Central location, can walk to shopping, transport, dining, bars. Unique decor (not cookie cutter). Friendly staff. Aveda toiletries. Cons: None

Reviews.Title: “Our teens loved this hotel and so did we! Fun,funky,great service&location.”
Reviews.Author: Roz78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with our teenagers in the Hagen Dazs Suite. We'd originally booked the double but needed more space and were upgraded with no hassle and suprisingly not too much more $$. The kids loved the inclusive unlimited ice cream in the room freezer and "teenager" shops right across the street! Safe neighborhood 30 steps from Starbucks, Chinatown, great, boutiques & shops, trolley. Two -3 block walk to affordable great cafes/local Italian delivery to room, yummy! We can't say enough about how wonderful the staff was~ helpful, friendly and very professional yet warm and fun. If you're looking for "cookie cutter" type hotel, this is NOT the place for you. If you're seeking quality, comfort, safety and psychedelic ambience, check this one out. Will absolutely return to the Triton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly-S-2010
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel under the Holiday Deal which included free parking & 30% off the best rate. I traveled with my sister & brother-in-law and booked the double-double room. Yes, they're small but it is a boutique hotel after all, and besides we didn't travel to San Francisco to hang out in a hotel room. The location is wonderful! We purchased the 3-day Muni Pass and were able to travel the entire city from the hotel. The hotel staff was friendly, cookies were a yummy treat, and the evening wine was a wonderful opportunity to unwind prior to heading out for the night. The beds & pillows were incredibly comfortable and the room was cozy! Three of us were able to easily share the double-double room. We had a room facing Grant Street, and yes we heard street noise and the dumpsters being emptied; if you don't want to hear typical city noise then I wouldn't recommend staying anywhere in the city! The window units do provide some white noise and shields the outside noise as well. I had a problem with the bill at check-out, and asked that they email a final bill once corrected ~ it arrived within a few hours perfectly corrected! Again, wonderful customer service! I would absolutely recommend this hotel if you're looking for something eclectic with a great location!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best finds ever!”
Reviews.Author: vphb
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at a Kimptpn Hotel and I'm sold.Incredible staff... Friendly and accomodating!Great location with a wonderful cafe next door. Loved my time there!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in ideal position”
Reviews.Author: wanderer23
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Boutique hotel decorated in 60's style Pop Culture. Very colourful and retro. All of the staff were extremely helpful and friendly which makes such a difference to your stay. Free wine (good quality) 5-6pm which was a nice touch and helped you to unwind before venturing out again. Also cookies for free at reception in the afternoon. Hotel is ideally situated for attractions, shopping etc. Room was a bit small but that was OK as the bed was large and comfortable. I would definately stay at this hotel again probably due to the friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky and Great”
Reviews.Author: rut1na
Reviews.Content: The initial shock when you walk into the lobby will wear of quickly as you get settled in. The hotel really is something else than all your normal hotels. If you digg the arts even a bit you'll love this hotel. It's at an great location, right outside the Chinatown gate and only a couple of minutes walk from Union Square and the great shopping opportunities. It's a walking distance from almost everywhere Even walking to Fisherman's Wharf isn't that bad when you walk through Chinatown and Little Italy to get there. The rooms are quite small but still nice. Flatscreen TV:s and iPod docks are nice to have. The minibar is unfortunately locked with a key, but they key is available at the front desk and it was offered to us at initial check-in. The rooms we're basically very clean and only the bathroom had a couple of points that could have been a bit cleaner. Unfortunately we didn't have any kind of view from our room, but that didn't matter to us. A nice little touch are the really original "do not disturb"-signs. Choose Triton and your going to have a great time with a reasonable price in SF!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect San Francisco Girls' Getaway Resting Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Iskyee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quirky and unique and within walking distance of Union Square, Chinatown, shopping and lots of good eating. It is the perfect place to enjoy the city at Christmas time or any time of the year! Nightly wine hour with a tarot card reader for those who want to know in advance how much they are going to spend shopping! It is fun, hip and most of the time has good services. On the occasion that a problem with the plumbing came up, I got a free night for a future stay. Love this place - I go back every year.......... PS - They allow dogs for no extra charge!!

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: panseypotter
Reviews.Content: syayed here for 4days ideal postion opposite china town gates walking distance to union square pier 39 very trendy hotel rooms smaller than vegas but i expected that as most victorian buildings free morning coffee and tea and wine at 5/6pm plenty of restraunts surrounding this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Triton is just my kind of place”
Reviews.Author: JuniperLane
Reviews.Content: The Lobby of Hotel Triton says it all.....unique art and furniture .....bold colors....custom wall paper......I love it there and plan on staying again when I am back in SF. Rooms are comfortable and tastefully appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly Hotel near Union Square and China Town”
Reviews.Author: jkdaves
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Staff. Great pet friendly hotel with no additional charge for pets. No exercise area near by. Do not take pet to Union Square. Good park one block away through the gates to the China Town. If you are bringing your pet, make sure to take advantage of the dog pillows that are provided. Our dogs loved these pillows. The staff was fantastic, especially the door staff. Excellent with directions and recommendations. Wine tasting in the afternoon is fun.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal in downtown!”
Reviews.Author: copper16
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Triton really stood-out. Courteous, engaging, knowledgeable and always helpful! The Kimpton Hotels are known for their wacky dÃ©cors and off the quirky surroundings and this place didnâ€™t disappoint. Complimentary Happy Hour wine tasting every day in the lobbyâ€¦ and if youâ€™re lucky, Max will be there. Travelers could do a lot worse in San Francisco than the Triton. Conveniently located near Union Square, Chinatown and a ton of shopping. AAA members also get a really good discount. Make sure to ask about dinner at Sons & Daughters!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: manchestercanuck
Reviews.Content: If you want a hotel that will make you swoon, relax and just let you get lost in its ambiance when your awar from home try the Hotel Triton in SF. I encourage you to stay there and tell your friends too. Kimpton Hotels are the best..always cross reference at Trip Advisor of course before you book.

Reviews.Title: “A typical, wonderful Kimpton hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoanneZR
Reviews.Content: We love Kimpton hotels in general, as they are beautiful hotels which accept dogs, no problem, no fees or deposits and no big long list of rules to follow. This was our first stay at the Triton, right outside of the Chinatown arch. As usual, friendly staff, great service, beautiful room (if a bit small). Evening wine reception and coffee in the lobby in the morning. Valet parking fees were a bit steep ($50 total, I think) but that's the same all over San Fran. Would definitely recommend, and would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky hotel that ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: shawsrus
Reviews.Content: Funky hotel with each room decorated differently. Staff really good. Wine tasting each night. Position excellent for Union Square and China town. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel, with a design twist...”
Reviews.Author: theone_1011
Reviews.Content: Great location, small rooms but enough for 2 persons... Located at the chinatown gate and not far from market street. Quite street corner. The staff was very friendly, rooms where quite and clean... WiFi was free (Kimpton) and fast enough. Loved the iPhone clock radio and big screen TV... No free parking, valet might be possible...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KC2400
Reviews.Content: Spent five nights here for a family wedding. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A good selection of coffee is provided every morning in the lobby. Free wine was provided in the afternoon. Our room was a little small, but modern. When we checked in, our room had a musty odor. On request, we were able to switch rooms quickly. Another member of our group had a musty room. I was told (but didn't confirm) that the Triton is "pet friendly", so people with allergies should check into this. Location is very good: adjacent to China Town, and with many good restaurants and shopping within short walking distance. A little noisy at night. I think it was from truck back-up alarms in the adjacent neighborhood, or it could have been from neraby street construction.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Triton”
Reviews.Author: mlspina
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in San Fran at the Triton and loved it. It will definitely be on our list for any future visits. Great location near Chinatown and walking to Embarcadero, Union Square, and cable cars. We stayed for our 10th anniversary and they welcomed us with a bottle of wine. They also have a nightly wine reception. Friendly staff, loved the "staff dog" of the concierge in lobby. We had a corner room and the garbage trucks were a little loud, but it is a city. The overnight valet parking was $38/night so I recommend circling the block as their is a parking garage that looked cheaper right around the corner in easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at Hotel Triton was a fun one...”
Reviews.Author: KristiCastle
Reviews.Content: Our Stay at Hotel Triton was a fun one. The location was perfect for us, close to great food, and the enterance to China town. The hotel staff was very friendly and professional. The only drawback was that the shower head in the bathroom is very low. I am 5'4 and fit just fine. My husband however of 5'10 had a pretty rough go of it. We would stay here again but we hope they update their showers to be a bit higher for the tall people of the world :)

Reviews.Title: “Parfait”
Reviews.Author: Michel032
Reviews.Content: HÃ´tel idÃ©alement situÃ© au coeur de San Francisco. DÃ©co originale et soignÃ©e, chambres agrÃ©ables ave wifi gratuit si membre du progamme Kimpton keep in touch (inscription gratuite). Personnel accueillant et serviable. A recommander.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Kimpton Hotel steps from Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: ostatekitty
Reviews.Content: We had a short stay at the Hotel Triton in June - it was very fun! It's colorful and very uniquely decorated. Yes, the rooms ARE small, but you are staying in San Francisco, where space is at a premium. For a long stay, or if you have a lot of stuff, you might want to try one of the other Kimpton hotels in the city, but we managed. The only request that I might have is that they place a shelf or caddy underneath the sink. The sink is in a small alcove seperate from the bathroom and there is not a lot of space to put your stuff. Also, the A/C didn't work well - the room was pretty warm and the windows opened, but not enough to make a difference. That aside, the room itself was fabulous. There were 3 different cool light fixtures in the room and everything was colorful and very funky. They managed to find room for a mini-bar and we got a $10 credit because we are Kimpton In-Touch members. The bed was comfortable and the foam pillow that I requested was waiting for me. The closet was surprisingly large - it was actually bigger than the closet in the suite we had just left in L.A. The evening wine reception is a big plus at Kimpton Hotels. The lobby of the Triton is simply groovy - it was a great place to hang out during the wine hour. There were lots of friendly guests hanging out. So far we have stayed at 3 Kimpton Hotels and haven't gone wrong. If you want a really hip room near Chinatown, I recommend the Triton. And pets are always welcome!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, clean, great location!”
Reviews.Author: ClemonsA2
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Triton last week and it was amazing. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly! It was extremely clean and very well furnished with an artsy vibe. Great location at a reasonable price. Would recommend to everyone! Book ahead, because it will fill up quick!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this rip-off! Do not book through a third party agency!”
Reviews.Author: anonymoua
Reviews.Content: For anyone booking Hotel Triton through the agencies on this site (hotels.com, expedia, etc), hear this cautionary tale: My husband and I booked a king room through hotels.com a few days ago. When we arrived we were given a closet with a double bed. When we complained we were told that bookings through these agencies are "requests", not guarantees. Therefore, if the hotel fills up with patrons who booked directly, people like us get whatever is left over. No one is required to notify us that we will not receive what we thought we booked. In our case every room in the hotel was booked, and we were stuck with the one we got. The room was a tiny hole in the wall, clearly intended for a single person. There was only 1 robe and set of towels. We asked for a rollaway bed, in case we couldn't sleep on such a small bed. We were told we would get one, but when we returned from the theatre the rollaway bed was not there. We were told that we had not clearly asked for it, and they had given the last one to someone else. P.S: In the morning, (after a lousy night's sleep), when they delivered more towels, my toe was cut by the bottom of the door. When I called down to the front desk for a band-aid they told me there was a first-aid kit for sale in the minibar. They did eventually comp me the band-aid, but it took effort. I know many people who have loved this hotel, but in our experience, it was a creatively decorated, overpriced dump.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, very friendly, good service”
Reviews.Author: BrandBier
Reviews.Content: The first hotel of our tour of the West, where we stayed for 3 nights. The boutique-hotel is located next to the main China-town entrance, between a wine-bar and a bar-restaurant. The room (#403) was not that large, but very well equiped, the bed was perfect. The bath-room was good, nice shower with lots of water-pressure, so taking a shower was a feast! There was enough space for our clothes; a walk-in closet and some drawers. The staff was very friendly. We can highly recommend this hotel; when we will return to San Francisco we definitely book this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near it all in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: liongrad
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights at the Triton, and were pleased with the accommodations and location. You are literally right across the street from the Chinatown gate and a very short walk to Union Square. You're within a 15 minute walk to the Embarcadero and Piers. We really enjoyed being close to everything that we wanted to do in San Francisco. Wine hour and coffee in the morning are great touches! The rooms are simple, yet in an art deco style (very similar to some of the hotels we've visited in South Beach, Miami). The beds were very comfortable and we slept great! Cafe de la Presse is alright - great French Toast - a bit pricey, but as we found many of the restaurants for breakfast in that area were also pricey. Front desk staff very friendly and helpful. Would defnitely return.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at this hotel makes this hotel...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel makes this hotel 5 star. Anthony who works at the front desk was exceptional. The location is convenient to everything especially china town. There was plenty of shopping and eateries in walking distance. The rooms were nice and clean. We would definitely stay again. Hint: sign up for kimpton in touch member and receive $10 for mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: LouisianaConnie
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Hotel Triton we had traveled all day and were extremely tired. The hotel serves wine and tea from 5:00-6:00pm weekdays and we arrived at 6:15pm. Erik checked us in and sent us a glass of wine to our room which we received as the porter was putting our bags up. Erik later called and asked if everything was o.k. in the room and if we'd gotten our wine. One day they had a plate of warm chocolate chip cookies at the front desk for guests. These special touches made this hotel our favorite out of a 15-day trip. Our room was great also and it overlooked the gates to Chinatown. I will definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family who want to visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “A great chic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kcifuentes
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights while she attended a conference and I enjoyed the sites. The location is great- located AT the entrance gate of china town. The rooms a decorated nicely- funky and hip. The guys at the front desk were fantastic- gave us tips, directions, and even an umbrella to borrow. Lots of place to eat and drink near by. Right across the street from LuLu lemon (for the Canadians!). We got a great deal online (paid about $75-80/night). I will definitely stay here again, even if we have to pay a bit more!

Reviews.Title: “Cool place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Karlie
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a quick four night stay at the Hotel Triton in San Francisco. It was our first time to the city, so I wasn't sure how the location would be, but it was great. The hotel is right across the street from the Chinatown gate, and within walking distance to all kinds of bus stops. As soon as I walked into the lobby, I was pretty certain I'd made a good choice. The decorations are bright and fun, but not tacky. The lobby is large and has a nice seating area and TV (which they played the World Cup games on, which was nice). We checked in at about 11pm, and the young man at the front desk was very nice and upbeat. In fact, every time we walked by the front desk, whoever was there would always say hello or welcome back, and seemed quite genuine. We also ordered a cab the night before we checked out, and the young man who did that for us was also very helpful and friendly. Check out was a breeze and only took about 30 seconds. When I made my reservation, I signed up to be a Kimpton In Touch member (free), which gave us free internet access and a $10 gift card for the mini-bar that came with a note from the manager. Nice touch. We booked directly through the hotel website and got the "Stay 3 and save" deal, which saves you 30% if you stay 3 nights or more. This put us at $135 a night. I thought this was a good deal. We were in room 721, a Deluxe Room with a queen bed. The mattress was soft, the blanket was dreamy and the pillows were feather (can be foam on request). I almost always have trouble sleeping, even at home, and I slept great in that bed. The room had two closets, a desk, a nice looking flat screen TV, dresser and mini-bar. The bathroom had a shower/tub combo and nice Aveda soaps. Another nice touch is the artwork by local artists in the room. I really liked the atmosphere and design of this hotel. I would definitely stay here again. The only real reason I gave a 4 instead of a 5 is that they don't have breakfast. I would have given 4.5 if I could. There is a cafÃ© next door that we went to twice that you can also order room service from (more expensive than physically going into the restaurant, so we just went in), and there are tons of places in the area. They do offer coffee and juice in the morning, and I grabbed an apple from a bowl of them once or twice for the road. There is also a wine hour daily at 5pm, but we were never around for it.

Reviews.Title: “Looks great but not so user friendly”
Reviews.Author: UKsisters
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights as part of a coach tour. Arrived around 8pm after a very long journey. The hotel had changed their check-in routine and each memeber of the tour had to check in individually, with a credit card required for a hold on the room. At all other hotels on the tour we were able to do a group check-in which was much quicker and convenient. Hotel looks very trendy and boutique style. Room was very small by USA standards, with 2 queen beds. Small bathroom with toilet/bath. Sink/vanity area was actually within the room, just inside the door. There was no space to put toiletry items and made using the room very impractical. Air con unit quite noisy. Beds/pillows very comfortable. Hotel location just opposite gates to china town was within about a 10 minute walk to Union square. No tea/coffee facilities in room, but complimentary tea and coffee available in reception. Was never at the hotel during the early evening when I believe complimentary wine available. One problem we encountered was that there is a notice on the back of the door telling you to put your valuables in a safe and not to leave in the room. When we enquired at reception about a safety box, we were told none were available and that their rooms were "safe" and "they had never had any problems". Obviously they do not have enough safe boxes to allocate one to each room, which is poor. Good location, looks very nice but small/impractical room.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it so much, we stayed an extra night!”
Reviews.Author: mjcount1234
Reviews.Content: We booked the Hotel Triton through a Travelzoo.com promotion. The price was right ($119 plus tax per night). We were greeted after a long flight with a glass of wine and a friendly desk staff (Anthony was our favorite). The room was fun and funky--not huge but big enough. The location was great (Grant and Bush, right at the main entrance of Chinatown). We walked or took the F Train everywhere. Best of all---the staff was great---offered terrific restaurant suggestions (with local flavor and decent prices), free hot coffee (good and strong) in the morning, cold drinks in the afternoon and wine at 5 for happy hour. We would book again if ever in San Fran and would try Kimpton Hotels in other cities.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: OttawaCat314
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried about this one, as I heard it was a boutique hotel. Sometimes, hotels call themselves "boutique" when they know they cannot compete with more upscale hotels. So I was a bit hesitant, but wow what a great place this ended up being! Every room was unique, and we got a yellow room with artsy deco and a tiny bed. It was cozy though, and the cocktail hour with free beer/drinks was great! I also loved the fresh cookies, the front desk girl told me to take a bigger handful, lol! Anyone who gives me fresh baked cookies usually wins my vote. But the staff here is as unique as the hotel, full of personality and friendly. One guy that was working the front desk came outside and opened the cab door for us, so we tipped him, and he tried to refuse our tip! LOL! We insisted and he swore up and down that if we needed anything at all, he would be there hand and foot for us! What a guy! On the last day I was there, I ran into that same front desk guy, and asked him where I can go for breakfast. I expected some posh tourist trap, but instead, he sent us to a crammed, inexpensive place called Sears Fine Foods, and told us to try the Swedish pancakes. When we arrived there, I thought it was a joke, the place was packed and had no privacy. But once I tried the food, I was in heaven. That place was incredible, and if I could remember the guy's name, I'd send him another tip just for recommending this place! They even sell mini rubber duckies in the room, and I bought one because this place was so memorable. What a hotel. Its indescribably unique!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms could use an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Scuba_Kim_8
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location next to the entrance to Chinatown, as well as great French restaurants nearby. Be sure to have breakfast at Cafe de la Presse downstairs! As for the hotel, the staff was wonderful and the decor hip as advertised. However, the hallways and rooms had an "old" musty smell and lacked small amenities such as an in room coffee maker. With just a little room updating, the hotel would be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific staff, nice location, hotel is typical boutique”
Reviews.Author: Inluvwithjapan
Reviews.Content: Charming staff. A bit forgetful, but sincere. Nice wine reception every evening, and morning coffee. Location of the hotel is central to most everything, although at night most things shut down since it's adjacent to the financial center. The rooms, like most in San Francisco, are tiny. The carpet is dark, so good luck if you leave dark socks on the floor. And because the carpets are dark, the rooms tend to be a bit gloomy. Window air conditioning units in the rooms means you can hear car traffic outside and the air conditioning/heating blows loudly. I think you get the idea. There are enough negatives that coming here is not necessarily a San Francisco treat (Rice-a-Roni reference), but the staff and the wine reception and the location are worth coming back. Me, I do prefer when I close the door to the room, that I am isolated from the noise, hustle and bustle of the city. Don't expect that if you come here. On the other hand, if you can deal with that, and enjoy a trendy boutique hotel with some comp'd wine at night...this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Aussietravellers78
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights here and enjoyed it. Decor is very funky and rooms are comfy, location and service were good, and we especially appreciated the free cookies and evening wine reception.

Reviews.Title: “The funkiest concierge & check in desk team! Service! & smiles all round”
Reviews.Author: jiffy2006
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two weeks in a corner room - on the smallish side, but the room furnishings were great - loved the pillows, artworks, ipod clock, loved the bed, loved the bath goodies, and the very funky bathrobes! We had a great view, but this did come with some noise at times. The staff at the hotel were the main attraction.. they were a charm every single day - nothing was too much trouble - from the cleaners, concierge, to the bell hops, to general maintenance you got the feeling that everyone wanted to come to work and enjoyed being there. Great recommendations for restaurants.. the boys know their stuff! Wine event each afternoon in the lobby was a nice way to kick back & relax. Thoroughly recommended, business or pleasure. Its NOT a boring hotel, it has character, charm and the warmth of a boutique hotel. It has a great location, close to Union Square, next door is Chinatown, and there are gorgeous restuarants beckoning.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed, good value, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: The_kosher_traveler
Reviews.Content: Just outside China Town in the center of San Francisco the Triton offers very good value. The rooms are comfortable (one problem, the air conditioner is right next to the desk and blows on you when you are working) but on the small side. That said, space is always at a premium in city center hotels and if you want a large room you will have to pay a lot more than this for it in this location. Staff were very friendly and helpful. You are within walking distance of almost anything downtown. Good public transport and cheap taxis. "Free Internet"? Yes, if you sign up (for free) to their loyalty scheme, otherwise there's a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Bed!”
Reviews.Author: ShootingGirl
Reviews.Content: Awesome location. Great bed with support. Really nice staff. Skip the room service (overpriced). Pricey, but I got a discount with MicroTek that made it palatable.

Reviews.Title: “feel alive in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: maurzzzz
Reviews.Content: A hotel with style..The Triton. Staying in SF numerous times, I came across this GEM. Bright, super clean, super location and the a staff that offers nothing but the best service. Coffee in the morning, Wine in the evening..If you dislike people, stay somewhere else! The hotel is surrounded by coffee shops, great dining and within walking distance to everything!!! China town is twenty steps away! Don't look for a coffee maker in your room, as it is served downstairs in the morning. Room service is offered by a local, but $$$. Need your cards read? No problem!!!! The rooms are somewhat crazy..from the theme type to the "just a room"...If you want something different try the Triton...:)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Cup_Cake
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 very comfortable nights at the Triton in April. The hotel is in an excellent location. Rooms are spotless and comfy, if a touch on the small side by American standards (not by European, though). All great in terms of comfort, staff, free coffee/wine, help, etc. If you are a light sleeper, ask for a room at the back as the front gets a bit noisy - we remedied this by keeping the fan/air conditioner unit on all night to provide 'white' noise to drown out street sounds. Problem with movie channel was fixed promptly by friendly staff. Tip for parking: the Sutter Street Garage which is literally half a block up Bush Street does an overnight (leave before 8am) special of $8. Excellent value, and soooo close you are almost parking in your hotel room. No neeed to bother with expensive hotel valet when this is so close. Breakfast at Cafe de la Presse ok, but better options abound. Pat's Cafe, Mama's, Dottie's True Blue to name but a few that are in walking distance...

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made my trip”
Reviews.Author: SarahNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful, funky, friendly hotel right by the gates to chinatown and right in the union square area. They have a very welcoming and freindly staff. They have daily coffee in the morning and wine social in the late afternoon. It was so nice to come back to the hotel after a busy day, have a glass of wine, and strike up a conversation with a fellow guest or staff memeber. The beds are delicious; soft enough, not too soft, the comforters great, and the whole room was just delightful. I was fortunatel enough to get a corner room. The desk was in the corner between the windows. The morning I stayed in to work, didn't really feel like work in such a nice place. I would definitely go back to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: gapkid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Triton while visiting San Francisco for 5 days and had an awesome stay there. To start, everyone at the front desk was very friendly, welcoming, and helpful. They also informed us that complimentary coffee is available in the mornings and complimentary wine in the early evenings. We took advantage of both, and so did a lot of other hotel minglers. Because of the free morning jolt of caffeine provided at Hotel Triton, the Starbucks across the street didn't get a lot of our business like I had anticipated. It was also nice to come back from a long day of walking/sightseeing and find a tall glass of wine waiting for us. The lobby, elevators, hallways, and rooms are very clean and decorated with modern furniture and accents. The rooms aren't huge, but they have all of the necessary ingredients to provide a little home away from home. The building may look (and is probably) old, but the rooms are all updated. Best of all, Hotel Triton was conveniently located for everything that we wanted to do. Chinatown was right outside our door, the major Union Square shopping district was right down the street, the BART train to and from the airport was only a few blocks away, and everything else was just a walk, cable car, streetcar, bus, or train stop away. I would definitely recommend the Hotel Triton to anyone thinking about visiting the San Francisco area. It's a great value; in a great safe, location; and provides exceptional service and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative comments - this really is a gem”
Reviews.Author: D1JBS
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights at the Triton (based on reviews here) whilst passing through SF on Honeymoon. From the moment we arrived the front of house staff couldn't do enough to make us feel welcome. When we arrived in our room we found a handwritten card from the entire hotel staff to congratulate us on our wedding, along with complimentary chocolates and Champagne ready chilled in an ice bucket. We also just missed the daily wine tasting - so they sent up a complimentary bottle of Sauvignon Blanc. You just don't get these kind of touches with the big brand hotels. We booked a King Room, which had corner views over the Chinatown gateway and was very smartly decorated. Guests from Europe wouldn't find the rooms small - it is quite normal with a building this age, but I can see why anyone more accustomed to Hiltons or Marriotts might find them on the small side. For us they were homely in the way you would expect from a boutique. And yes, you can here the sounds of the city outside at night - but this should be expected given the hotel's central location and in our view just adds to the atmosphere. Having stayed in Downtown SF on business a couple of times in the past in the usual corporate hotels, the Triton really made the city feel different this visit. Thoroughly recommended to anyone with a taste for hip hotels looking for a romantic getaway with a central location.

Reviews.Title: “I like conventional chain hotels...but I'm a Kimpton fan for life!”
Reviews.Author: SCashCalifornia
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Kimpton, and it was only for one night. Oh, how I wish I could have stayed a few more! As the title says, I'm a fan of conventional hotels - give me a Hilton, Sheraton, Hyatt - because I know what to expect and can get my mind set appropriately. One of my staff booked my stay at Kimpton, swearing up and down that I'd like it even though it was a little "different". He was right on the money. I had a room that overlooked the China town gate. It was a very small room, but it had everything I needed and then some. The staff was fabulous. Even though we'd missed the Manager's reception with the free wine, I was offered and given a glass upon check in. All of my questions were answered. They graciously stored our luggage after checkout so we could go to a meeting unencumbered. Ordinarily when I go to SF for pleasure, I stay south of the bay and BART into town to save a little money and not deal with the city hassles - but I'll be going Kimpton from now on. The next trip I made to SF I stayed in a different Kimpton (Hotel Pacific) which was even *better*!

Reviews.Title: “Coolest pillows ever and it has rubber duckies”
Reviews.Author: TheJillahs
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. It was the first stop for our honeymoon, and they gave us a congrats card and wine and chocolates. The sink is the funkiest thing ever, it's all mirrored and pretty. The lights were clourful glass thingies -super cool. Its the closest hotel to Chinatown gates, great location. Don't go to the Starbucks opposite the hotel though - these aren't London Starbucks. There's a living room at the front of the hotel where they offer FREE WINE at 6pm. It's also very close to the shopping districts - like one or two blocks away. Staff were friendly too. Its a scenic half-hour walk through Chinatown and the 'real' San Francisco to get to the famous Fisherman's Wharf. You also walk past a Safeway supermarket - Yes Safeway still exists in America! It even has the same logo as it used to in England :-( Anyway, yes we totally recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: detachedretina
Reviews.Content: After years of enjoying this hotel for mini vacations in SF, we suddently were informed of a new "policy" that leaving before the night (we stay for the day) would incur a $100 EARLY TERMINATION FEE. What utter nonsense! So you pay for the room and are fined if you choose to leave before the morning? What a way to treat people who have stayed with you many times for many years. We will no longer frequent this place and will make sure our friends and family know about they way they treat loyal customers. May the other many great boutique hotels in SF enjoy the business instead.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Day”
Reviews.Author: vjrraven
Reviews.Content: I love this city and this trip! The hotel was great, guess which celebrity room we stayed in?

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: NedL
Reviews.Content: The excellent staff and comfortable stay at Hotel Triton were highlights of our trip to San Francisco. Every one of the staff we encountered was incredibly friendly and willing to help out in any way possible. The room we stayed in (an Eco Premier King Room) was nicely furnished with plenty of room and was very quiet. Some of the fittings (mainly in the bathroom) were a little bit dated but everything was very clean and in good condition. There's free wi-fi throughout the hotel and a free (pretty basic) fitness room in the basement. The free daily wine reception is a great opportunity to sit around and have a chat to the staff and other guests. The location of Hotel Triton is good in that it's within easy walking distance of Chinatown and Union Square. Muni Metro, BART, the F-line streetcar and Powell cable car line are all within a five minute walk so it's easy to get anywhere in the city and to/from the airport via BART. We'll definitely be heading back to Hotel Triton on our next visit to SF - it's great value and I honestly can't think of one bad thing to say about our experience there!

Reviews.Title: “Quirky little hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Lamica
Reviews.Content: Summary Great little hotel with fun freebies like wine tasting and cookies. Rooms are small with no views but it's location is great and service very friendly and helpful. Location Right at the China Gate you can walk to North Beach, Exchange Square, even to Mission though it's very close to subway. Valet is $35 a night but its not really any cheaper elsewhere. Rooms Small and very small windows so bit dark but quirkily decorated and perfectly clean and comfortable. Tiny bathroom, again though clean and fine Service Friendly and helpful Bar and Restaurant The cafe next door is the bar and restuarant where we had some great cocktails but didn't eat. However our friends who live in San Fran said its's a great cafe. Breakfast is an odd affair with oj and a muffin delivered to your room in a paper bag but you have to pop downstairs if you want coffee (free in the lobby). Make sure one day though that you pop round the corner for the world famous pancakes!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and really friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: hankpop
Reviews.Content: I love staying at Kimpton Hotels when I travel. I picked this one in San Francisco because I knew it would be in a busy area of town with lots of restaurants. It was a great choice. I went for some great morning runs over the San Francisco hills over to Fisherman's Wharf. I loved being by Chinatown and also being close to the BART station. I booked a ZipCar that was parked a half a block away. The staff helped me find the kind of restaurants I wanted to eat at... in fact, the kindly answered all my questions (how to take the BART, how to get here and there.) The room was small but cute and the hotel feels like an old building brought up-to-date with modern amenities. I love ending each day with a free glass of wine in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very pet friendly, cool decor and free wine happy hour...what more to ask for?? oh, right by chinatown”
Reviews.Author: TadP
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after finding a great price online in planning for a west coast roadtrip. It had decent reviews and had never statyed there. Traveling with a pet kinda makes it complicated in finding decent hotels that accept dogs (real dogs, above 12 pounds; mine's about 55 lbs). It was in a great location right across from the welcome gate to Chinatown, had a great room rate, accepted pets, so I booked it right away for three nights. Only downfall (although I didn't see it as such since I was on vacation and having been to the city before knowing on street parking is at a premium) was the price for the garage parking provided by the hotel. I believe it was $20 a night. I wanted to spend my time in other pursuits than searching for a parking spot. But my truck was available for me to use or get stuff out that I had forgotten to take out with just a phone call. It was pretty convenient and well worth the cost to eliminate any vehicle parking hassles. The hotel staff was very friendly upon check-in. I brought my dog in and they put her name on the "pets at the hotel" chalkboard on the front desk visible for all. Although, she can't read, i'm sure she was proud to be recognized. And being a nice dog, everybody loved her when she was in the elevator, hallways and front lobby by guests and staff alike. The decor was very upbeat and cheery throughout the hotel. The room was kinda small for two people and a dog, but really on vacation, a room is just a bed to sleep in and any niceties are a plus (just my opinion). BUT the room was very well maintained and clean with all the amenities (flat screen TV). Very comfortable and a nice bed (queen) as well. Decent toiletries soap and shampoo and such that aren't like the cheap scrub your skin off and leave you dry and bleeding soaps at the right off the interstate sketch hotel soap. Very nice to take a shower and use the products provided. All in all, this place is pretty cool, hip and a in a great location. Right by the BEST chinese food you could ever get in the country! Great stay and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: brooke2h
Reviews.Content: I shopped all over the downtown/ Union Sq. area and really wanted to stay at a Kimpton hotel but was having to stay within the budget of my company. I decided on Hotel Triton and was not disappointed! I checked in late and had not had dinner. I had many snack options from the well stocked mini bar! The room did smell a little musty but it is an older building. It wasn't overwhelming but it was noticeable. But....that will not stop me from staying there again. I just checked out this morning and have already made 3 new reservations for my business trips in the coming weeks. EXCELLENT location and very clean. This is my new "go-to" hotel in San Fran!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for someone travelling alone”
Reviews.Author: IreDen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during July for 5 nights. It was my very first time in the US and since I am coming from Europe I was really worried of what to expect in terms of quality, service and of course safety in my hotel and room since I was travelling on my own. The first impression was the best. Very polite and typical at the same time people in the reception.The room was exactly like the pictures I have seen and they cleaned it every day. The location in San Francisco was perfect, around 5-10 min from everything important downtown.No homeless people around in the evening but of course I didn't return back after 22.00. Totally a good hotel maybe a little expensive for a solo traveler but I always prefer to spend something more and not having to worry about my stuff,my mood etc. If I return to San Fransisco one day I would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: nmsouthwest
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a pleasant surprise. The "hip" theme scared me a bit, but basically, it was a neat, clean hotel in a wonderful location. The staff was friendly and professional, the room was very clean and comfortable. I particularly appreciated the filtered water. No need to run to Walgreens for bottled water. The only negative I can think of - please, take out all the overpriced items from the fridge. All I want is a small fridge to store a few items. When I return next year, I hope to find and empty fridge. Do that and I would consider this hotel one of my top picks in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “They used window-type air-conditioners!”
Reviews.Author: Alan73
Reviews.Content: My travel agent asked me to go for this Triton Hotel because the neighbouring Marriott hotels were found full 2 days before the start of my business trip and I settled for it accordingly, as it was only for one night "transit" stay. The hotel location is convenient and the staff friendly, the common areas and the rooms are slightly worn out but acceptable. The main problem is that the rooms are equipped with "window-type" air-conditioning units which are noisy when operating, and gives no fresh air. [N.B.: Travellers who read this review may trust my judgement as I have been belonging to the property discipline for many years.] After switching on the units at night for 2 hours, the room becomes nothing but noisy and stuffy, lacking oxygen. To open the windows for fresh air means 2 other problems: firstly, my room (and may be half of the rooms in such hotel) faces the side lane where the refuse rooms of the hotel and other adjoining buildings are located and can catch such "unforgettable" smell; secondly, the service vehicles and refuse-collection vehicles in US operate at nights, with their dumping and travelling noises throughout the night-time. So, the result is: "shallow-sleeping people" like me cannot sleep. Fortunately, it was only for one night stay, and I presume I would not be returning again unless they install some centralized ventilation system with treated air. One point worth mentioning: the hotel's web-page didn't show any "window-type" air-conditioning units in any of their rooms' interior photos, and "experienced people" like me would return to the website and find from the exterior night-view photo some ideas of the "window-type" air-conditioning units along the dim facades.
