I wished I had noticed those "window-type" air-conditioning units before I agreed to my travel agent's former offer.

Reviews.Title: “what a wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tedlongford
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights and it was just fantastic peaceful and the staff we're so helpful would recommend this place anytime

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: UnPocoMejor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and it was a really nice experience. The staff was very friendly and helpfull, the room was nice and the location is super! The complimentary wine hour was also nice and we got to chat to lots of other nice guests.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel, rooms a bit underwhelming, Nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: heartdocat
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Kimpton for a Hematology meeting in late 2008. The Kimpton brand was interesting and it the was our first stay at this hotel. Arrived late Sun night with a large rental car and hungry colleagues. Check in a breeze and chocolate chip cookies calmed the hungry stomaches. Lobby is cute but smallish and the elevators a bit slow. Arriving in the room it was funkily decorated and overlooking the street. A bit of "old guy" smell. that dissappeared with running the AC. he hotel is sort of interesting in that it seems like they took an OLD building and funkied it up. An example is the average light fixture has a painted shade. The bathroom fixtures worked well but were a bit old. The room was a bit dark. Had an ipod dock which was a nice touch. Aveda products which my roomate enjoyed a lot. The hotel staff was nice and they had a slick print server to get some documents I needed printed done. One thing I enjoyed was the "happy hour" where red wine was served and a bunch of us hung out in the lobby. Pretty limited seating though. The location is very good. Next to the Chinatown gates and near some shopping "Ugg" "Banana Republic" etc. It was quiet and safe. Nearby 7 eleven and a reasonably close starbucks. There was a high end breakfast place on the corner that looked good but overpriced. Only a couple of blocks from Union Square and Macy's and Victoria's secret. Overall a decent hotel. Much cheaper than say the Westin but in my opinion you don't get as much. Happy travelling.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here whenever I can!”
Reviews.Author: Sibok07
Reviews.Content: We loved the Triton for its helpful and friendly staff; the cute, clean and quiet room, and the central location. We were able to walk all over The City from there. We hadn't had a vacation in some time and this helped make our trip great.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: SStuart
Reviews.Content: Although the room was not as expected given the photos on the website, I would definitely stay here again purely based on the exceptionally friendly hotel staff. Nothing is too difficult and you really feel like you are staying with some friends rather than at a hotel! The hotel is uniquely decorated, but despite staying in the queen deluxe, the decor in the room was pretty standard. A nice touch is that you can borrow hair straighteners/curlers for free! The wine at 5pm and cookies at 3pm is also special. Perfectly located.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Thierry_Swiss
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location, just few block from Union Square. In the morning you can get Tea or Coffee and at 5pm you can get some wine (white and red). The room size is good for an hotel in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SarahinManchester
Reviews.Content: This hotel could not have been more perfect for a base for our week in San Francisco. The staff were friendly and helpful - they answered queries by email before we arrived and let us check in a few hours early because our room was ready when we were only expecting to drop off our luggage and check in later; the decor is funky; the hotel is clean and well equipped. The best bit? The water feature at the front complete with rubber ducks - genius!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Julie J
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in the Triton and had booked it after being impressed with the Kimpton hotel we stayed at last year in Washington. All the staff we met were friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a great central location. The rooms werenâ€™t as small as I was expecting from having read other reviews, and are clean and comfortable, although some additional shelf space in the bathroom would be helpful. We used the fitness room a few times during our stay and this was well equipped, as others have said, the coffee available in reception is a nice addition, however, we didnâ€™t get back in time for any of the wine evenings. There is an Irish Pub right behind the hotel (less than 2 minutes walk) that we used a few times where you can get snacks and basic pub food that was quite good

Reviews.Title: “Location (by the Chinatown gates), Friendly Staff - Perfect Spot”
Reviews.Author: erinwyher
Reviews.Content: The location, directly by the Chinatown gates, was just right because it makes the hotel one of the easiest to find in the city. It was a quick walk from the hotel to the 30 bus which you can take to skip the Chinatown mobs and get to other parts of the city. When we arrived on Thursday late afternoon, we checked in with the nicest front desk attendant. He was able to give us a recommendation for Thai food nearby, at OSHA. We took his suggestion and found the place to be just as he described - no frills but great food and fast service. The room we were assigned was just two doors down from the Kathy Griffin suite and because we're both big fans of the D List, we were pretty enchanted every time we walked by the door. I'm a terribly light sleeper but was never awakened by noise because our room was facing the courtyard. It was utterly silent every night - thank you, Hotel Triton. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was clean and small but perfectly sufficient. We also had pretty fast internet connection via the free Kimpton rewards wifi. The coffee service in the mornings was free which is an amenity that is hard to find lately. Moreover, the coffee was tasty and strong and there was soy milk in addition to milk and cream. I would be sold on the coffee service alone. I have absolutely no complaints. This was the perfect hotel for a young couple from the East coast, like my husband and myself. Everyone working in the hotel was beyond helpful: from the cleaning person on our floor, to the valet at the door, to the front desk attendants, to the wine hour host.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian_SEA
Reviews.Content: I took a 4-day weekend getaway to San Francisco in April 2009. Doing various web searches for budget-style hotels (I'm typically a budget traveler, even staying in hostels around the world), I found the Hotel Triton to have an incredible sale. For ~$100 / night, I figure I couldn't go wrong considering the truly great location in central S.F. I wasn't wrong. Triton fulfills some major requirements that I look for in hotels: Proximity to public transit to/from airport (only a few blocks walk from Montgomery St. BART Station and even close to cable cars and certainly many bus lines), price, and wireless Internet (it's even free). It's central location is the major bonus for me. The hotel is a small-ish boutique hotel right across the street from the Gates of Chinatown, and within walking distance of North Beach, the Financial District, Tenderloin, etc. It is a bit of a haul on the electric trolley or Muni to the Castro - but I only went to the Castro once or twice. Most of my time was spent sightseeing the central areas of the city, and happy hours in North Beach (Vesuvio is an absolute must). Yes, my room was small and my window looked onto an alley - though I didn't spend much time in my room. I was visiting San Francisco to explore the wonderful city, not the insides of a hotel room. In fact, the staff let me bring a bike that I had rented into my room for safety. The afternoon wine reception was nice (and free), though the wines were, of course, not the best quality (read: free). One complaint - the 2nd day I was there, the maid did not replace my bath towels. I only had one towel out of 2 left. Not the end of the world, but I had rented the bike and needed to shower when I was done with riding for the day (riding up and down those hills can make a guy sweaty), so I had to use my last towel to shower that evening and then use the same one the next morning. All-in-all, as a solo traveler/explorer, I would absolutely stay at the Triton Hotel again, given the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fun & Hip in a Handy Location”
Reviews.Author: DJMadruga
Reviews.Content: Adorable! Loved the chic decor and how glamorous -- yet cozy and comforted -- I felt in my luxurious, hotel-supplied animal-print robe following a hot shower and a quick forage through the honor bar (it'd been a trying day!). No, the rooms aren't big but just right for my daughter and I. No view from our room (tiny windows facing the interior), but the funky zebra-striped headboard, a vibrant red wall and whimsical prints upon the walls kept me quite content while indoors. The room was exceptionally clean, the staff accessible and the wine reception a nice touch. (Although, come on, why not do the tarot card readings for a nominal $5? That 'd be more fun.) Best of all, the terrific location invites you to easily visit Chinatown on your right, Union Square to your left, cable car access all around and much more. At the $100 rate I received, I have never stayed at a better San Francisco hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Understated and fuss-free...a gem”
Reviews.Author: chillywinter
Reviews.Content: Our exerience at the Triton was unreservedly a good one. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful without being horribly pushy/over-familiar. We took advantage of the free tea and coffee in the morning (which was a real bonus to anyone who finds Starbucks coffee weak and unpleasant) but were always too busy to partake of the evening wine tasting. Our room was on the back of the hotel on a high floor, which meant that we weren't disturbed by noise at all. Sure, it was a wee bit basic-looking, but I wasn't in SF to sit about in a hotel room. The hotel is perfectly situated for some serious shopping (some of it very high-end, if that's your thing) - it's close enough to dump your first haul of the day before going out for round two! Cafe de la Presse next door did a good hearty breakfast, but here's a tip for those of you who can't take a big meal first thing - we would often trot down to the Westfield Centre on Market Street and buy a yogurt from the Bristol Farms store in the basement, and a Peets coffee to accompany it. There's plenty of seating and it's a good place to plan your day ahead. Some more tips: the MUNI pass was fantastic value. Buy yours from the Dick Dale fan in the booth near the cable car turnaround on Market Street. Go to Sausalito on the ferry if you can. What a gorgeous place. The de Young Museum in Golden Gate Park is a cracker and (I would saw) better than SFMOMA. The Triton is definitely worth considering if you are thinking about a trip to The City.

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel in downtown”
Reviews.Author: Meigs
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at a Kimpton and I had been warned that rooms tended to be small, so I wasn't surprised. It is located in an old building which accounts for the size of the room. We had a queen bed and the room was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was clean with plenty of towels. The staff was very helpful recommending restaurants and reserving a cab to the airport. The location was great. Only a 10 minute walk to the Mascone Convention Center. Our room was quiet with no street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: kimparker
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in San Francisco and I couldn't have stayed anywhere better. Great location, two blocks from Union Square, across the street from Chinatown, and a twenty minute walk to the Wharf area. Very safe, spotlessly clean, friendly and helpful staff. My room was one of the Zen Dens, which was fun and colourful and comfortable and quirky, like the rest of the hotel. Loved it- it even has hot tea in the morning free, and complimentary wine in an evening which was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tiny room with good service and location”
Reviews.Author: nynytraveler
Reviews.Content: The room was small and run-down a bit, but everything was clean. The location is good and the front desk staff were helpful. I got a good price on the room and would definitely recommend if that price was available again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky Boho-Fun”
Reviews.Author: Smackdab
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while consulting in San Francisco. Fun, great for a younger crowd. Super convenient location. The rooms were kinda beat up, and the place doesn't have some of the polish of other Union Square hotels, but it is right next to Cafe de la Presse and there is lots of fun people watching.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: DocBrass
Reviews.Content: Found this online for our trip to SF. We wanted to stay somewhere that was different before we met up with friends later on in the week. Convenient location to everything downtown, right at the gate to Chinatown We even have had a few friends stay here before, so that helped in our decision. It is a little pricey for what you get in amenities. The wine party is pretty neat to get to mingle with other guests. Staff was very helpful and also good in recommending local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: mjsatch
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came for a little New Years getaway and found this hotel to be wonderful in every aspect. The location was great. The staff was accomodating. You can't go wrong with a stay at the Triton.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted!”
Reviews.Author: livinator
Reviews.Content: Super comfy beds, amazingly convenient location, nice little touches that keep an old San Francisco hotel from feeling old and commonplace! Very clean, though a bit tired if you are looking really hard, but everything worked and the bedding couldn't have been better. I booked on Expedia 3 hours before arrival and got a great deal; everything was just what I needed. Something fresh and fun, not expensive, but comfortable and convenient. True that the rooms are small, and the bathroom tiny, but cheap rooms are not for people who are spending lots of time in the hotel anyway. This was perfect for a Paddy's Day getaway; convenient to the downtown neighborhoods and a safe, fun environment. Great for the younger crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: IANTOJONES
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Triton and really enjoyed my stay. The staff at the hotel were very friendly and the rooms were perfectly adequate for a short stay. If I was staying longer than 5 days I would probably stay elsewhere as the rooms and bathroom are very small. For a few days this did not really matter. The beds were very comfortable and being on the 7th floor it was fairly quiet. As mentioned already the bathroom was tiny with the sink outside. However, the shower was good and fairly powerful. The hotel offered nice touches such as free coffee in the morning, fresh cookies at 3pm and a nice free wine reception at 5pm. Nice additional touches. Location is perfect. Right next to China Town Gate, just minutes from Union Square and Market Street. I recommend the hotel for a short stay right in the heart of San Francisco. The staff are great and the rooms comfortable. I would stay at the Triton but the rate would have to be right. We only paid Â£65 per night which offered excellent value for money but I would be reluctant to spend too much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff and bit quirky”
Reviews.Author: alimarjo
Reviews.Content: So many times, staying in hotels can mean being stuck in the same old boring formulaic hotels. So the Triton was a really refreshing find!! Located right opposite chinatown gate, and ideally located for shopping and tourist attractions. The brightly cloured lobby was a great place to wait for people, with free coffee in the morning and winetasting from 5-6pm. All the rooms were decorated differently, with artistic touches, and interesting artwork was to be found in corridors. The only downside was the rooms were quite small, but their unique touches certainly made up for it. There was no restaurant in the hotel, but a great cafe for breakfast next door, which also provided room service and was also good for a quiet drink in the evening. The staff were really friendly, and helped us find a number of good places to eat in the evening closeby and were always cheerful. Will definitely be staying there when I return to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Best location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: McCarthyMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Triton for a week over Christmas and had an amazing holiday in San Francisco. The hotel location is perfect. A 5 minute walk to Union Square, Macy's and a 2 minute walk to shops that we loved like H&M, Banana Republic and there's even a Starbucks across the street. The staff are so helpful and can recommend anything. We would definitley recommend doing an open top bus tour if it is your first time in San Francisco. The room was small but very cosy with a great tv that had lots of channels and the shower was very good also. We stayed over Christmas and it was very different to the one we have in Australia but it was still lovely. The gym was very nice too, it was open 24 hours. They also have fresh baked cookies at reception every evening and they are so delicious! The whole family loved the Triton and we can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not good.”
Reviews.Author: N6812T
Reviews.Content: This hotel could be cool, and is a cool idea, but was run down. Paint peeling, smelled bad, and small. There are just too many options in San Francisco to use this one. Try something else.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay at the Triton”
Reviews.Author: ChocolateTourist
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Triton off and on for over 10 years. Always had a nice, comfortable stay. Location is outstanding, right at the gate to Chinatown, close to Union Square and Bart stops. Rooms are small but comfortable with nice bathrooms. Lobby is funky but staff is very helpful. And Cafe de la Presse next door has a very nice breakfast menu. Enjoyed the complimentary wine/beer and cookies. All at a nice price. This is an excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: kwlew
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Triton approximately 20 times in the past five years while in the city on business, and each time, I hate leaving the property. The entire staff, from the valet to the manager is cordial, knowledgeable, and accommodating. Its proximity to Union Square and Chinatown are a definite plus. I love the ever changing decor, the rooms are vibrant, cozy and comfortable. If you're lucky enough to get into one of the celebrity-themed suites, you're in for a real treat. The decision to stay here for any length of time is a no-brainer.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels in the world”
Reviews.Author: NiamhOConnor
Reviews.Content: I often stay at the Triton hotel in San Francisco when I am on business trips. The location couldn't be better: at Chinatown doorstep, there are many nice restaurants close to it and very good shops. The staff are extremely nice and helpful and the rooms are comfy and funky! Love the decoration. I wish all hotels could be like the Triton. Really looking forward to going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: sbond
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Triton for 3 nights with our baby and the location was absolutely perfect. Right in the heart of the shopping district, and a short walk to the Muni, GOMA, and all the downtown areas. There is also a great French restaurant and wine bar on either side of the hotel. It's important to note that a "suite" does not have a separate living/bedroom area - it is just one room. I felt that the price for the room was too expensive for just one room (we booked an advance fare on the hotel website and it was in the high $200's - unlike the $50 that some lucky people have paid on Priceline!). The decor of the Wyland celebrity suite was definitely not to our taste, but the room was clean and comfortable. For the location alone I would stay at the Hotel Triton again and book a standard room if I was travelling without my child.

Reviews.Title: “Fab fun hotel - with free cookies!”
Reviews.Author: supersuper
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel at the bargainous rate of $50 per night via Priceline and had a lovely stay. It was a really cool, fun hotel. The free cookies in the afternoon and free wine in the evenings were a big plus. We decided to extend our stay and stayed at a few other business hotels afterwards, as the Triton was full. They seemed a bit bland after this one!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it so much that I'm going again!”
Reviews.Author: ShaBar1
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at the Triton. I requested a quiet room away from the elevator and I got it. The staff were really helpful. The room was very clean. The bed was very comfortable. I loved it so much that I have already sent friends there and I am going to be staying there again on my next trip (next week). The location is great. It felt safe coming 'home' at night. It's walkable distance from lots of really great shops and public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but small”
Reviews.Author: Marstar
Reviews.Content: Nice boutique-type hotel across the street from Chinatown entry. Hotel was tastefully decorated . The room was small but adequate for our trip. The parking was $38.00/day! Hotel allows pets. For $80, I preferred staying at the Nob HIll Motor Inn which was more central and had FREE parking!

Reviews.Title: “Best night in SFO”
Reviews.Author: ChicoRoo
Reviews.Content: Sick of boring hotels and motels, we stayed in a large fancy hotel on Union Square the last time we visited San Francisco and although we enjoyed the ambience, we always wanted to give the unique boutique Hotel Triton a try. This time we did, via Expedia, and it was the best decision! My teenage daughter and I stayed in a small double room on the 7th floor with a view of the street below. We loved the bright, fun, but tasteful decor, zany bed heads and furniture, light fixtures, and exhilarating bathroom with good powerful shower. Everything was spotlessly clean, and the two double beds with their luxurious pillows were the most comfortable hotel beds we've experienced in a hotel. The bathrobes were also a nice touch and although we didn't buy one, we were sorely tempted! We liked being able to open the window to fresh outside air as well as having access to an air conditioner, and appreciated the obviously environmentally-friendly policies (recycling, "green" products, re-using towels if willing, etc.) the hotel follows. They even welcome pets! As we drove through the night and then spent the entire day walking our feet off in the city prior to checking in, the Triton provided just the comfort and fun atmosphere we craved. True bliss! Crazy-bright decor and furniture in the lobby with complimentary wine in the late afternoon and good coffee in the morning, a bustling cafe next door and a Starbucks across the street, the entrance to Chinatown a few steps away, and helpful staff on reception at all hours made our stay most memorable. The hotel also has a good location, within walking distance to many highlights, and close to public transportation. Usually we object to the high cost of valet parking in the city and choose to leave our car in the Union Square underground parking garage and walk to our hotel, but this time we made the right decision, leaving our car with the Hotel Triton valet staff. For only a couple of dollars more (plus tip which they deserved!), our car was whisked away, in an out privileges were available (not available at Union Square at the less expensive 24-hour rate), and they even let us park outside the hotel on the street for a little longer so we could walk to the Museum of Modern Art area where it's really hard to find parking. We really appreciated their concern and assistance. My daughter also loved the Triton rubber ducks floating in the fountain at the entrance. Nice touch! We enjoyed sipping coffee in the lobby in the morning, watching people discovering the ducks with amusement as they walked by. Good photo opportunities! We highly recommend the Hotel Triton, and will stay there again. Tip: The cafe next door has great chocolate croissants, and the main street of Chinatown has endless eating opportunities.

Reviews.Title: “Triton is tops”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoBeerfly
Reviews.Content: I already liked Kimpton properties for their small, unique boutique approach to hotels. Every time I step into the room of one the major chains I feel like a little of my soul disappears. Hence, I'll take interesting personality over bland uniformity even if the former means the occasional surprise. A surprise we were handed at the Triton recently when our stay was going dandy until our car was "trapped" by a broken door at the offsite garage the Triton uses for valet. But how the Triton staff did backflips to deal with situation was the real and rare delight. Our vacation didn't miss a beat as they found us cabs (and paid for them), comped meals and the valet charges. I imagine they could charge some of these expenses back to the garage, but even if they had to eat some they, in exchange, got a customer for life. And one willing to write his 1st TripAdvisor review ever. Even without the above incident-turned-delight, our stay at the Triton was terrific. Fun rooms, killer lobby, entertaining staff, nifty SF locale, fair price too. Plus, we love Kimpton's real deal sustainable business practices.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel -Great Location, Staff, Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: LARachel
Reviews.Content: Hotel Triton in San Francisco is one of the Kimpton hotels --and when you stay at one of the Kimpton hotels, it's never a dull experience. The Hotel Triton is lovely! The rooms are all so unique and decorated with flair and style. The wine hour is awesome. The staff is amazing --they're friendly and so helpful. I love this hotel! I would recommend staying here when you're on vacation or business --the location is within walking distance to the Financial District and to Union Square. It's fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but different experience”
Reviews.Author: sheltiegirl46
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Triton Hotel and enjoyed our stay very much.The hotel has many unusual features compared to other hotels we have stayed with such as the "wine hour" and the decor.If we had anything to complain about it would have to be the garbage trucks every night at all hours of the night.I am not faulting the hotel as we are sure they have little or no control over this matter.Hotel staff was wonderful.We received help from Tim,Anthony,Melissa and Tommy and they all were very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: atrain1983
Reviews.Content: I named my price from priceline.com and received the Hotel Triton as one of my options. The logo looked vaguely familiar but I decided to go with my gut instinct and book the stay. It turned out to be one of THE BEST hotel stays I've had ever. Not only are the celebrity suites fun and kitchy :), the service from everyone on staff was superb! The concierge desk recommended great restaurants and places to visit, helped me when we were lost in the city, not to mention everyone was extremely personable and friendly. The complimentary delicious cookies and "cocktail hour" each day made each day A LOT brighter as well. The location was a great central location for everything we wanted to do in San Francisco. I won't stay anywhere else when I return to the city.

Reviews.Title: “tack o rama”
Reviews.Author: xanadugirlz
Reviews.Content: I am writing this from the Hotel. I will come update it if there is need. My husband wanted to try somethong new and quirky for our friends 26th birthday (we usually stay at the mark hopkins) so we chose the Hotel Triton, because we had walked by and knew its in a GREAT location, and its a kimpton and weve stayed at The Hotel Monaco in Seattle many times...So we get two "Celebrity Suites" I think they are $359 per night each. After viewing the rooms online, we request the King Triton suite and the Hagen Daz suite....So we get to the hotel at 11pm or so and check in, it is me my husband and one memmber of the other party. The guy was really nice and told us all about where to eat and drink nearby, and the lobby is cute and they have rubber duckies ion the fountain. So the three of us and the hotel worker go up to our room (the other room comes later) and we get in the King Triton suite (supposedly the BEST room they have) and it REEKS like smoke....and someone had put plastic wrap all over the smoke detector...so he brings us air freshener and opens the windows (which look out on some weird wooden scary platform and other rooms) anywayz the room is BEYOND tacky (i have stayed at an adult theme motel before....and really it was better) there are mirrors everywhere, and a bright red light in the tub room (also tub is small one person jacuzzi like the size youd have in your bathroom at home). Also as we walk down to meet the other person, we start to nitoce more and more how the whole hotel is so obviously a former crack motel that they tried hard to make pretty...sagging floors, peeling wallpaper and paint....dirt in weird spots...weird staircases...So its like 1145 now and our friend has parked in front of the hotel and is getting out....we all walk back in. No employees in sight, finally my husband searches one out, and they check her in...she has the hagen daz suite....we go into check it out...MUCH BETTER ROOM than the kinf tritin suite.....much newer and much more care put in (still some uneven paint etc) has very cute fully stocked (free) freezer....the bed rattles tho every time you move even a bit....definitely a nicer room though....so she realizes the pillows are all down and she needs foam...we take the elevator of hell (it randomly goes to unrequested floors and stops) down to ask for some....."sorry we gave them all away" were told. And thats where we are so far.....more later....

Reviews.Title: “Fun & Funky!”
Reviews.Author: Texicans
Reviews.Content: I love this place - it was so fun - all the rooms were funky and it is a pet friendly place. We got upgraded to a king size bed and the room had a great view. It was very clean and the staff was absolutely great! They were all so helpful. There is a complimentary evening wine and beer social time - we met some great people and watched the fortune teller do her magic. Right next door is an Irish Pub called Irish Bank - it is great! We met some very flavorful local people and had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Triton!”
Reviews.Author: af3
Reviews.Content: After reading several of the reviews here, I was a bit concerned that I may not enjoy my stay at the Hotel Triton. There was no need for concern as long as one is prepared to make the right requests. The staff could not have been more pleasant and accommodating. Nick at the front desk made sure I got a quiet room...the most quiet ones face an inner atrium. No view, but perfectly quiet, otherwise you'd face some busy streets or worse yet, an alley with garbage trucks emptying their loads early mornings. As an Kimpton In-Touch loyalty member, I received some bonus amenities- a bottle of vitamin water and a can of some dried cranberries, banana chips, and nut mixture, even a personalized letter from the desk manager welcoming me, a very nice touch! Gemelli, the bellman, was terrific- he retrieved new card keys when mine didn't work, got ice, explained the new flatscreen tv, etc. He always called me by name and was just overall gracious, as were all the staff I encountered. The room was small, but whimsically decorated. The queen bed was extremely comfortable, bathroom included only a shower which was fine by me. Wine hour from 5-6 was great, nice to chat with other guests, repours generously given by the director of sales for the hotel. Yes, this is a different type of hotel, not the staid business kind, but lots of fun and well-kept.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, trendy, great location”
Reviews.Author: jt2s147
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Triton is a very unique hotel with some cool features that suit people who are tired of the monotonous lodging choices. My wife and I spent a weekend there and really enjoyed our stay. When you walk into the lobby you'll think you're in a trendy night club. Lots of different colors and cool/colorful lighting accented with eclectic furniture. The rooms the same style.....modern and trendy. They are a little small but we didn't mind at all since most our time was spent enjoying San Francisco. The things we liked about the hotel: - The overall style. It's definitely a cool place to stay - Complimentary happy hours. The first night we had a drink in the lobby while a DJ played before dinner. You don't get that at other hotels. - Service was great. - Location Some cons: - The free wireless internet. Yes, its free but very slow. You have to pay for premium service but I think that is the only service that works. - The rooms are on the small side, but like I said that wasn't a big deal for us. Overall, if you're up for something trendy, modern, and exciting the Hotel Triton is right up your alley.

Reviews.Title: “San Francisco Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Genevax
Reviews.Content: Hotel Triton is somewhere I had been wanting to stay for a while and fortunately, a business trip came up that would cover the cost. Yay! The hotel is on the south edge of China Town on the corner or Bush & Grant. Great location, easy access to taxis and public transport. The lobby is very cool with an eclectic mix of furnishings and color. I was upgraded from I don't know what to a king size bed on the 7th floor on the Bush side of the bldg. My co-worker was in a "daybed" on the 3rd floor on the Grant side. He said there was quite a bit of street noise and had a hard time sleeping through it. My room seemed to workout pretty nicely. No street noise, but I did turn on the fan for some "white noise". The room was pretty modest in size, but very quaintly decorated. I loved it. The bathroom needs some shelving/wall storage next to the sink. The bathroom is small and counter space is minimal, so shelving would have helped. Towels are great - plentiful and fluffy. The TV is pretty small. Someone in another review mentioned a flat screen TV being a good addition and I agree. The honor bar had some good stuff in it, but high prices as typical for something like that. The business center is a desk next to the check-in counter. Very fast and nice computer though - at $5.99 for 15 minutes of internet time. Doooh.... In the morning, there is complimentary coffe/tea in the lobby. No food. Early evenings is a happy hour, but I could never make it back in time to make. Bummer. I love San Francisco and if you wanna taste of the funky side, I suggest this hotel. My teenage daughter would love. I would return again....if I could afford it. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “A fun favorite”
Reviews.Author: mwoodside
Reviews.Content: I love the Hotel Triton! The location is perfect for a weekend getaway in S.F. Immeditaly in front of the gates of Chinatown, it's a short walk downt he street to Union Square. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They make great concierges. I;ve stayed in a few rooms here but loved the Jerry Garcia Suite most. Great Tub! Just around the corner Belden Lane is tucked away. A great spot if you want a little French Quarter dining. One of the few outdoor dinner spots in the city. Triton honors the Kimpton happy hour and the guests have wine and visit in the lobby. They often have chair massages avilable and I've seen tarot readers there during happy hour as well. The hotel is pet friendly & there are water dishes near the door. This is a really fun place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Shortest stay ever! But liked every minute.”
Reviews.Author: Lombard955
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I live in SF, but due to a scheduling snafu over the holidays (too many parents in town at the same time) we found ourselves in need of a hotel for one night. Priceline, and Hotel Triton to the rescue. We checked in at midnight and out at 8 AM, pretty short for a hotel stay, but I can say that we had a very restful night, and even managed to find free street parking! I have stayed in many Kimpton hotels in SF, and agree with the assessments that the interiors here seem a bit tired, but I am also a bit over that particular aesthetic. That said, the location is fabulous if you are visiting from out of town.

Reviews.Title: “Rainy & Windy outside, warm & toasty inside”
Reviews.Author: klpopp
Reviews.Content: The weather outside was frightful, but our stay at Hotel Triton was delightful! We were taking a 1 night foray into San Francisco and I checked the hotel's website and the price was reasonable. After they sent me an email if I would like to upgrade for $9, I did it and we ended up with a corner room on the top floor with a view of the entrance to Chinatown! The room was cozy, but clean and comfortable. The employees were helpful and friendly from check in right through advice on which way to bring the car for a fast getaway in a driving rainstrorm!

Reviews.Title: “What an Awesome Way to Ring in the New Year!!!”
Reviews.Author: sd10sarah85
Reviews.Content: I was on here reading the reviews of this hotel because I just returned this morning from a trip there. The hotel was awesome the rooms are BEAUTIFUL! If you like bland cookie cutter hotels go stay at a motel 6. This was my first time to San Francisco and I think I talked as much about the excitement of the sights of the city as I did about this hotel. The front desk was friendly and helpful at all hours of the night (we stayed for New Year's so we came back pretty late). They helped us find an awesome club to ring in the New Year's and even made the reservations online for us. I stayed there with my boyfriend and 6 of his family members. We all had awesome rooms and felt that the staff and hotel were excellent. I can't wait to go back to San Francisco just to stay in this hotel again! When I get the pictures we have of the hotel developed I'll post those too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, night-time street noise pretty intense”
Reviews.Author: Fast_Eddy33
Reviews.Content: Had a 4th floor corner room (Grant & Bush) with nice views, but the night-time street noise was intense. It wasn't the traffic so much, but people shouting; early-morning trash trucks and sidewalk washing. Granted, it's probably average for that part of town. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. If you shop around, you can probably find less expensive parking than the $43 overnight valet service.

Reviews.Title: “A sweet suite!”
Reviews.Author: wiggles_her_nose
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Triton on our wedding night; we were married in San Francisco and wanted to stay over in the city before embarking on our honeymoon (we're locals). We'd heard great things about the Triton from friends, and everything we heard was met or surpassed. The Triton was friendly, accommodating, quiet, and wholly unique. The room we had was beautifully furnished in hip, offbeat decor, and we didn't hear any noise from the street below when we went to bed. Furthermore the staff were very friendly when we checked in and checked out, and they left us a sweet letter in our suite congratulating us on our marriage and offered us free drinks. They also carry Aveda bath products, which is a definite plus! That said, this hotel is definitely for the 20-30 something set, I think. It has a younger vibe; they have a DJ playing house music downstairs during their complimentary wine hour in the afternoons. This is not to say that those of other generations will not appreciate the Triton; it is uniquely San Francisco in a lot of ways.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: leahbeth40
Reviews.Content: I read plenty of reviews of this hotel before booking it. Many of the reviews complained about the room size and the noise. I decided to ask for a room away from the elevator, alley, and on a higher floor. My stay was wonderful! The room was very nice and clean, and it was not like a sardine can as others have suggested. The size was just fine for my husband and me, and we enjoyed it. I noticed someone said the bathrooms have showers only, but ours was just a regular room and we had a bath/shower combo. Bathroom was stocked with Aveda products (small, travel sizes of course), and the mini bar had lots to choose from. True, there is no bar or restaurant in the hotel, but right next door is a little cafe where you can get wine, pastries, and other food. Plus there are tons of other places nearby. It is located in Union Square right across from the China Town gate--perfect location! Overall the decor and hotel condition is a little old-seeming, but it was not bad. We stayed just 2 nights, and I have no complaints. I did not need ear plugs, but it's a good idea to bring them "just in case" when staying in a city if you're a light sleeper. The one bad thing is that there was a sign on the inside of our door that mentioned the dangers of lead (can't remember for sure but I believe it was lead) in the building. I think it said something about not having prolonged exposure to it. I wasn't too happy about that, but since we were only there 2 nights I figured it would be o.k. Overall, a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique past its best”
Reviews.Author: LondonWanderer99
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Triton in Grant Avenue downtown San Francisco promises to be a fantastic boutique hotel experience to counter the usual Holiday Inn or Marriott experience. Location-wise it could not be better, located just a block or so from Union Square, though I suspect the nouveau boutique reviews were written a while back. The $ rate was good for the location, though (read on) I guess you get what you pay for.... The unique hotel decor is entertaining but a little tired. It has little in the way of facilities: there's no bar or restaurant, though there are loads in the neighbourhood. I was overcharged for the minibar and the movies and had to have it corrected. My room was small and poorly lit. The free WiFi signal was so bad in the room I had to take my laptop to reception to work - there's no hard-wired broadband in the rooms. My "view" was hugely unattractive and of the side-street garbage bins and local restaurant staff puffing their cigarettes, but I was out all day and most evenings so not the end of the world. 1st night I was woken at 3.10 am by the hotel alarm clock, which to be honest I hadn't checked but was incorrectly set by 6 hours. 2nd night I was woken by next door's restaurants emptying hundreds of glass bottles into the bins one-by-one between 2.00 and 3.00 am. Every night I was woken between 5.00 and 6.00 am by the garbage collection trucks. Lousy experience - I'll never stay there again and don't recommend it, as there are so many better San Francisco hotels these days.

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to come back!!!”
Reviews.Author: buickgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Triton with 3 other girls for a dental convention from September 26-30. Our hotel was booked through the ADA but I picked it out because I thought it looked like fun. From the second we got there to the second we left we were treated like old friends. Remember the old saying, treat others the way you would like to be treated. If you walk into any hotel with an attitude or a chip on your shoulder you're probably going to get the same in return... and ya know what? Ya probably deserve it. Anything we needed they were right on it. They made dinner reservations for us on a few occasions and if we needed anything else they took care of it immediately. I didn't seem to need anything though. There wasn't a thing wrong with the room, the beds were comfortable, and the room was clean. Anyone that complains about the room size is just being a pain in the rear. you think that's small? Go to Europe! If you want a bigger room go stay at a $400 a night hotel! Who cares! I'm not 500 pounds so I had a fine time getting around with my roommate and I don't plan to be in the room but to sleep anyway so that shouldn't even matter. I loved the fresh cookies and wine offered. All free. I also thought the complimentary massages and tarot card readings were cool. It's dog friendly which is nice for those who need it. But I didn't see one trace of any animals the whole time I was there. It's located in a great area, right across the street from China Town. And for those who complain about the noise, get over it! IT'S A CITY PEOPLE!, there is going to be street noise. I slept like a baby. You think thats bad... go to New York!! If you want 100% absolute quite go stay in a bed and breakfast in the mountains of Montana! Gee, some of these other reviews really errked me! At any rate, this is a great hotel, there is a fantastic pub around the corner called the Irish Bank, ask for Mark, tell him Alicia sent ya. I can't wait to go back and I am definatly staying at the Triton! Oh and just a note for you single girls out there..... there is no place on earth better to meet single STRAIGHT men! :)

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay and the hotel, but some of the staff do have an attitude.”
Reviews.Author: gmx5050
Reviews.Content: I got a really good deal thru priceline ($80 a night) and my request for a quiet room was honored. I was very glad to get a quiet room in this part of SF. This was my first trip to SF and I think this hotel spoke to the uniqueness of the city. I liked the aquatic theme they had going on the lobby. The room worked just fine for me. It looked and smelled clean and I slept well. I can see how some people would find it tacky. I would never decorate my own place with a zebra-striped headboard, but it was fine for a few days in my room. I can also see how more than 1 person in my room could become uncomfortable. I liked the eco-friendly touches in the bathroom (i.e. instead of bottles of shampoo and conditioner, they had a wall-mounted dispenser). I liked the Aveda products they had on the counter too. My favorite part of the hotel was probably the elevator lighting (pink and blue instead of flourescent) which, IMO, made being in the elevator fun and more relaxing. I didn't use valet because I just garaged my car most of the time I was there. I wanted to use public transport and experience the trolley. I found it very easy to find parking in lots nearby a block or two away that were cheaper. Had I wanted to go in and out, though I have no idea if this would've still been cheaper. There places to eat close by (i.e. a Starbucks across the street), so food was easy for me to get. The cons were most of the people who worked there. Where the courtesey they pay you to have in hospitality? Where's your SF pride? Such a great city. You have so much to be proud of! Not the friendliest staff or the most helpful. I think I met one nice person behind the counter. They put cookies out in the afternoon and they'd good. I probably wouldn't return to this hotel unless they have a major customer service overhaul and mainly b/c I didn't prefer the union square/chinatown area. I definitely wouldn't pay full price for it. But it was a unique experience for my first visit and convenient to transportation, union square and Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Colorful”
Reviews.Author: Meyta
Reviews.Content: The Triton is in a great location right next to the gates of Chinatown. The good -Pet Friendly -Organic coffee and tea available in the lobby every morning -Aveda Toiletries -Soft bathrobes -Great wine reception -soft & wonderful linens The bad -Room size -Musty smell in some halls -shower only bathrooms -small elevators -smelly gym

Reviews.Title: “Met Our Expectations”
Reviews.Author: xkittyx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Triton for one night before heading up the coast. I requested a king room, an early check in and a high floor. The staff met all these requests. We were at the hotel at 11 AM and although check in was not until 3 our room was ready. I thought the rooms were fine. We had a king room. I would agree with past posts that said the rooms were small, ours was small, but it's a city hotel so we expected that. The Triton is an eclectic boutique hotel and the decor is "funky". Personally, I liked it. Our room was immaculately clean and the bed was very comfortable. I thought the staff was fine. No problems with them at all. A very pleasant surprise was their work out room. Not very big, but good equipment all in top working order. You can't beat the location. It's right across the street from the Chinatown gate and walking distance to Union Square. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: sunmountain06
Reviews.Content: Location: Good - walking distance to Union Square & other restaurants. Staff: Mostly friendly and helpful, but got some attitude on questions about our room. General Feel: Did not like this hotel. Really funky and just not our style. Some people call it "fun" - we called it weird and borderline tacky. Experience: It's a Kimpton property so expected much more than what we got. This was a work related trip w/ spouse and our first night, we were given a double room, right across from the elevator door and it was clear someone had been smoking in the room previously despite their non-smoking policy. The room was also tiny. The remaining nights were were moved to a King room which was still small but a little better for 2 people. The room service option was a French restaurant next door and the menu was very limited in terms of options and types of options. There were some nice perks, free wine/beer in lobby from 5-6pm, coffee in the AM, cookies in the afternoon. But none of those things made the room experience any better and we were there for 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Small and Lousy”
Reviews.Author: Diegodad2
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on Priceline. Now I understand why they have to sell rooms at such a discount. Despite being a Kimpton (I've stayed at the Palomar and the Monaco before and loved them), this was one of the worst hotels I've ever visited. The rooms are impossibly small, so small that Stuart Little might find the room cramped. Dominating the rooms is an enormous armoire (apparently, the letters "L-C-D" have not reached the ears of the management). These rooms are not "cool-small" like a New York hotel, either. They're just small. If one is lucky, one might get a tiny window with 6 feet of clear view to another window. My room had a view of netting used to keep pidgeons away, although there were several pidgeons roosting there. I felt like The Birdman of Alcatraz. This hotel was disappointing in every way one measures a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smaller rooms, good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: ED204
Reviews.Content: We had a small problem with our reservation but it was resolved quickly and professionally. The rooms are small, but it's an older hotel and the rates are generally very good for the area. The free wi-fi could use an upgrade, but it worked when it needed to. We'll be staying there again. While it's not the Ritz, it's not a bad value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Michael_D78
Reviews.Content: The Triton is a smart little boutique hotel located right by Chinatown and a few blocks from Union Square. The design is pretty quirky - outlandish furniture and bright paint abound. The 2 lifts are lit in bright blue and pink respectively and are liable to induce headaches as a result. The lift doors are also very narrow, causing trouble when moving luggage. The rooms are tidy and smart but a little small, even by SF standards. The bathroom is especially small, with the sink in our room outside the bathroom as a result. There are some neat touches at the hotel though. Free cookies baked twice daily are delicious, as is the daily wine reception at 5pm - you can sample a few wines and beers at no extra charge. The room also features iPod speakers which are great if you have an iPod. Overall, I would say the hotel is possibly over priced, but you won't have a bad stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: bealocal
Reviews.Content: Both my husband and I travel extensively for business and have those weird traveller needs. This stay was business for my husband, but pleasure for me, so this reveiw takes both perspectives into account. We are in our mid-thirties, used to live in SF, and like staying at nice hotels, but not stuffy hotels - so we chose the Triton over the W or the Clift. As previous locals, we would have stayed in another neighborhood if it weren't for the conference (staying downtown can be intense), but since we were here for business for him - it worked out great. Positives: -The Triton hit our criteria of staying where other folks our age stay, not being stuffy, and being within walking location to transit (great bonus for heading out to dinner in other neighborhoods) and the convention at the Moscone Center - perfect. -Our room was between a maid's closet and a stairway, so was very quiet. We were here over a weekend and during the week and I never heard anyone partying or being loud. -FREE Coffee in the morning in the lobby was awesome. When you travel a lot it is a pain to have to shower and run down the street for coffee every morning for a week. It was so nice to bop down to the lobby to get some free organic coffee that tasted pretty good. -Small fridges in the room so you can get yogurt and water, etc. and keep it in the room is a huge plus. Nice to have breakfast for yourself to cut down on the eating out 24/7 (even though it is heavenly SF). -Staff was nice and helpful. One thing though - they forgot our 3:00 am wake-up call and 4:00 am taxi, but it worked out. -Huge bed - I barely knew my husband was there. Negatives: -I took an earlier review into account and asked not to stay along the alleyway (good call), but our room was facing the courtyard and had absolutely no view. I think I would prefer to be along Grant or Bush. -We didn't book for the decor - which online looked obnoxious, and it was, but that's okay. -Our room was small. We looked in some other rooms which seemed a bit bigger, but we decided it being quiet was a trade off for size. -The decor needs to be updated. The room seemed worn. This hotel could really be served well to update itself. I hate it when the bathroom grout is grey/black and all the floorboards are beat up, the wall paper is peeling, etc. Though our housecleaning was great - the room just seemed like it could be cleaner. We stayed in an ECO room and the carpet is the same we have in our house, but it was time to replace it. The little rugs were kind of nasty. If you are walking around SF you really need to take your shoes off in the room, they should have a shoe tray by the door to help emphasize that. Overall, I would stay here again because the positives outweigh the negatives, but I would investigate other places first. We like places that are a little cleaner and a little better updated. If you are used to the Ritz, don't stay here - if you like a funky edge, the smell of cannabis floating through the halls, seeing healthy young American's and European's, and an overall good location for downtown business, then stay here.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to sleep don't stay at the Triton”
Reviews.Author: BARNESLONDON
Reviews.Content: The Triton is awful - shockingly bad. Having read Time Out's review and some on this site we booked for three nights. Arriving in San Francisco with our young kids and full of high hopes, we stayed for just one night and couldn't get out quick enough. OK, it's in a good location, has a quirky reception and groovy carpets, but that doesn't make a good hotel. It's cramped, dated, tired and ill-equipped. The idea you may â€œâ€¦bump into Cher or Courtneyâ€� here is laughable. Perhaps they did once stay here a long, long time ago but I bet they never came back.. Pete Doherty would probably like this place. Here's five things we particularly hated about it. 1. Small rooms - the first room we were shown had two small beds (double double) crammed in, leaving no room to even open a suitcase. All the bathrooms we saw were tiny. 2. Grotty decor - we were then moved to the 'Gerry Garcia suite' for an extra $100, which looked like it was last cleaned 15 years ago. Gerry must have been very stoned when he 'designed' this room, as the only 'design' was a poorly painted nicotine brown chequer board effect on the walls. It looked like a crude stage set. Were the floral curtains and (greasy) headboard borrowed from Gerry's mum's house? Gloomy lighting, chipped paint, knackered furniture, worn carpets - it had it all. We accepted because we couldn't face moving again with young kids after a long journey but it was pretty grim. What constitutes a suite? This was one medium size room with a double and sofa bed. 3. The noise from the rubbish trucks at 10pm, 3am and 4am, right outside the hotel was deafening and unbearable. It woke us all up, and just as we got back to sleep another one would crash around, reverse lights beeping, crushing glass bottles just below the window. It turns out that the street next to the hotel houses all the bins for the street's shops and bars, but god knows why they needed to empty them so many times during the night. And why the hotel doesn't invest in triple-glazed windows to keep the sound out is beyond me - I can't believe anyone would experience that level of sleep deprivation and stay a second night, let alone come back or recommend to a friend. They knew full well about this but still proceeded to put us in this â€˜suiteâ€™ quite happily. 4. The staff - nice and well-meaning but not great on service. We asked for a babysitter, and the guy at the desk spent an hour looking before giving up. Only he didn't bother telling us that he hadn't found one, and when I went back to ask him if he'd found one he said he'd been looking on Google but couldn't find one! At this point it was too late in the evening and we had to take our tired kids out to dinner with us. Maybe they're not used to children, but they're part of the Kimpton Group, so all he had to do was call a sister hotel for their recommendation. Also, our DVD player didn't work and the guy they sent up couldn't fix it and really didnâ€™t know what he was doing. And the wireless log-in didn't work, so I had to call the support line. At this point I was getting pretty cheesed off with the place. When we complained about the noise the following morning the manager nodded knowingly â€œAh, yes, the garbage trucks..beyond our control Iâ€™m afraidâ€�. 5. There's no bar, and no restaurant. Yes, there's a bistro next door, but it's hardly the same as being able to pop downstairs for a drink at the bar. The 'wine-tasting' comprised a few bottles of cheap Banrock Station (Australian!) Chardonnay and a couple of bottles of Zinfadel - hardly the introduction to Californian wines I was expecting! After our night of disrupted sleep we stumbled down to reception to make our complaints, and to their credit they reimbursed us the extra $100 weâ€™d paid and moved us to the (excellent) Argonaut, a sister hotel and part of the Kimpton Group. This we highly recommend and was great for the kids. The Triton needs some serious investment to bring it up to scratch. If you want a good night's sleep, look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, .... but!”
Reviews.Author: catwings
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Triton for two nights in Feb. I had the same experience as one of the other reviewers. I had a room on the third floor facing the alley, and about 3 am the garbage trucks started arriving and emptying dumpsters. If you stay at Hotel Triton request a room on the other side of the building. They were very nice about agreeing to switch me to another room when I asked. They moved my luggage while I was out. When I returned to my new room I discovered water all over the floor of the bathroom. I called the front desk and they sent someone up to clean it up. A little while later the water was back, so I requested another room change. They found a third room for me that was quiet, although not a king sized bed, but that was ok with me by that time. The third room had a sink that was very slow to drain, but I could live with that for one night. The staff is very nice. They are obviously trying hard to make guests comfortable. The decor is funky and interesting. They have a complimentary wine hour in the afternoon and fresh baked cookies, and even a Tarot card reader in the lobby for entertainment. The room rates are reasonable and the location good. But there are some shortcomings with the facilities that make me unsure whether I would stay there when I visit SF again.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Jerry Garcia suite”
Reviews.Author: jspin
Reviews.Content: the place had great ambience and a funky decor. Management was friendly and the location was super-convenient for downtown business meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!”
Reviews.Author: LLori
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Triton for 4 nights recently and booked through Hotwire for a competitive rate. I expected to be treated to a small room and so-so service based on various reviews (guidebooks, websites, etc). My brother stayed here and proclaimed the rooms to be tiny. We received a room on the Eco floor (7th floor) facing away from the main streets. The room was small, but not uncomfortable in my or my husband's opinion. The bathroom had been renovated with a granite countertop and tiled showerstall. I found our room to be exceptionally peaceful and quiet, perhaps because we were on the top floor. My only problem with the Eco floor was that the shower gel/shampoo/(thin & runny) conditioner was in a dispenser on the wall, but not filled with Aveda products (the normal amenities in a Kimpton hotel). The hotel remedied that when I requested for them. The hotel was a good value- great location (next to Chinatown, steps from shops, close to the BART/MUNI/cable cars), nice perks such as morning coffe & tea, newspapers, fresh apples, cookies. They willingly credited my Kimpton rewards even though I booked through Hotwire. The only service flaw I encountered was at check out, with the less-than-friendly sole front desk person was involved with her personal telephone conversation. I'd probably stay here again and request the 7th floor and steer clear of the rooms facing the elevators which blare music.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Jerry Garcia Suite”
Reviews.Author: Redfox40
Reviews.Content: A really felt like I was in SF, staying at an eco-friendly hotel with funky decor and Greatful Dead inspired themes. Staff was super friendly and suggested some great eats nearby.

Reviews.Title: “It's the Staff People”
Reviews.Author: Robertspider
Reviews.Content: The rooms are well above average, the restrauant excellant, however the Hotel Staff is the best out there.. For a great time, where you don't feel like a stranger, the Triton is AAA+ Close to everthing in San Fran...If you stay you won't be Sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: L1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. The location is great - very central. The hotel is unique and we found it to be good value. I was a bit surprised at how small our room and bathroom were, but it wasn't a problem since we were hardly there. The front desk people were very helpful. We would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “bad experience”
Reviews.Author: hbla
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel before and had a mostly good experience, however, on a recent trip our vehicle was damaged by the hotel and/or their valet service. The manager and the valet admitted the damage and accepted responsibility -- that is until we checked out and left. I guess they were just telling us what we wanted to hear. Once we returned home, we received a hostile letter from the valet company refusing to accept responsibility. We tried calling the hotel management to remind them that they had accepted responsibility but they never once returned a phone call or email. It's bad enough that they damaged our car, but it took them forever to bring the car around in the morning causing us to be late for an important meeting with an investor. Why the hotel management would behave this way and mistreat its customers is a mystery to us. Buyer beware!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Triton gets an A+”
Reviews.Author: sterlingbaby
Reviews.Content: We booked this room from a reccomendation from a friend that lives and is a tour guide in San Francisco. We loved this hotel! Since I travel for my job and stay in the major hotel chains (Hyatt, Westin, Hilton, etc.) The Triton was a breath of fresh air! In one word - Unique! The Hotel is old but that's what gives it the charm. Our room was very small but the ambiance was incredible. Very clean! The decorating was WAY cool. FREE wireless internet worked perfect for us. The bed was so comfortable after a day and night on the town. Good sheets and a down comfortor. Bathroom was small but the shower excellent with soft towels! The room had a flat screen tv and also a radio that I could plug my iPod into. Refrigerator with mini bar. The front desk staff was most helpful. Gave two wonderful suggestions for fantastic restaurants. Also printed maps for us. They serve wine every evening from 5-6 pm and coffee and tea every morning. Even the elevator is an experience! It is in an excellent location; right at the gates to China Town. Walking distance to Union Square, North Beach, and The Ferry Building. I will stay at The Triton when I return to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: WRT
Reviews.Content: You canâ€™t beat this location, right at the Chinatown gate on Grant Ave, five minute walk to Union Square, Market Street, cable car stop, and BART station. I took BART from the airport to Montgomery station and easily walked to the hotel. Even though I knew nothing about SF, I had no difficulty finding the hotel. SFâ€™s mostly square-grid street layout makes it easy. All of the staff were unfailingly polite, friendly, and enthusiastic. At check-in, I mentioned that this was my first visit to San Francisco, and the front desk clerk gave me a map brochure, oriented me with the area, and made suggestions for dining and sightseeing options based on my interests. Music plays in the lobby, but it was inaudible in my 2 nd floor room. At the intersection outside my window, the crosswalk has a textured pavement, so there was a rough grinding noise every time a car went by, but the air conditioner on low speed provided enough white noise to mask the traffic noise. The weather was cool and did not require AC, so I ran it on fan-only, to circulate in some outside air. The room was big enough to meet my needs, but it was small. If you require a large room this might not be the best place for you. Yes, the hotel is old (which explains why the rooms are small), but it has been thoroughly renovated and is very clean. My room was immaculately clean, and I am very picky about cleanliness. It has a fire alarm system and sprinklers. Seeing that sprinkler head in my room soothed some of my worries about staying in an old hotel. Wireless internet worked fine in my room. Shower was luxurious. If that was a low-flow showerhead, I would never believe it. I enjoyed the hotelâ€™s morning coffee, but if you donâ€™t like their coffee walk to the Starbuckâ€™s directly across the street. If you donâ€™t like that Starbucks, walk 1 block to find the next one. SF seems to have a Starbuckâ€™s on almost every corner. I had a minor problem on the bill. I used a few items from the honor bar, and I filled out the tally sheet and turned it in to the front desk the night before I checked out. Unbeknownst to me, the maid had already charged for items used on prior days. This caused duplicate billing for some of the items. When I brought this to the attention of the front desk clerk, she cheerfully resolved the problem, crediting my account for the duplicate charges. She accepted my explanation without question, and showed no hesitancy or suspicion. Overall, I had a very pleasant stay and will probably stay here again on my next visit to SF.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: spanish_af
Reviews.Content: We liked it a lot. It was cozy and in a great location (across from the Chinatown gate). It was a bit expensive. ($200 after taxes). So I might try to find another hotel if I had more time to plan. (I booked about 6-8 weeks ahead). The music in the lobby is a bit annoying. But other than that it was nice. No pool or anything, but we don't care about those things. Only a few blocks from the BART.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice rooms - a bit small”
Reviews.Author: choward1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Triton for a week and overall enjoyed the experience. On arrival we were given a double room rather than a twin but we were switched without any complications or trouble the next morning. The rooms are very small but are clean and quirky as with the hotel in general - Prince William speaks on the early call alarm!! The staff was generally very helpful but there was one or two that are rude and totally unhelpful. The free internet access in the lobby is handy. The fortune teller each evening is a waste of money. The location is very good, within minutes of Union Square (which is very quiet at night), the hotel is at the gate of Chinatown and unlike alot of hotels is not on a steep hill (a major bonus). The restaurant was closed (for renovation I think) so I can't comment on it. I would recommend the hotel as long as you don't have a lot of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise...”
Reviews.Author: drmotx
Reviews.Content: Traveling in San Francisco for a conference and all the big named hotels were sold out when I came acrosss this wonderfully decorative place as an alternative. The location was great...being right across from the gates of China town and the staff were friendly. I was really pleased to see that the hotel was also environmentally friendly. The decor made you feel like you were living it up in San Francisco with a bit of chic sophistication. The rooms were small but I thought the were adequete if you are rooming with someone you know fairly well. The daily fresh baked cookies in the lobby were also an added plus. I was quite surprised at how much I enjoyed this whimsical little place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable accomodation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very excited about staying at this hotel at the beginning of our honeymoon as it seemed a bit different from the norm. We stayed in a number of different hotels during our trip and this was our least favourite as it was just a little bit tired. The location of this hotel is good, although we found that there are only a couple of decent restaurants in close proximity to the hotel. The lobby was nice but we started to see tired decor on stepping out of the lift on our floor. There had been a leak outside of one of the rooms and the wallpaper was all peeling off, with plaster and paper lying on the carpet. Our room was not very spacious but big enough. It was in need of some upgrading though in order to make it the trendy boutique hotel it is advertised as. The bed however was very comfortable and the bathroom facilities were fine, if a bit cramped. We found the reception staff helpful, but housekeeping don't give you much warning before bursting in so make sure to use your lock or do not disturb if you want to avoid that!! Overall we thought that you could find a better hotel for the money but this one would do fine for a central location for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “former Triton fan disappointed”
Reviews.Author: islandpoet
Reviews.Content: Hotel Triton has been one of my favorite San Francisco hotels â€“ but I was very disappointed during a recent visit. I first discovered the hotel in the mid-90s, and have appreciated its great location, artsy ambience, and stated views on saving the environment. Unfortunately, the quality of the hotel's guest experience has really declined, seemingly in favor of the bottom line. The building is showing its age and maintenance is below average. My shower pipes squealed loudly and bathroom sink drained extremely slowly. I reported both to the front desk, but neither problem was resolved during my stay. Many amenities now need to be requested from the front desk. I requested three amenities, and received just one, even after two requests. More troubling was the surprisingly low quality of service from the concierge and desk staff, who seem young and inexperienced. While a couple of the staff were courteous and interested in helping, a couple more seemed to lack aptitude in guest relations and etiquette. One concierge provided some major mis-information which wasted valuable time on my last day in the city. At check out, there was a problem with the room service portion of my bill, which we were unable to resolve. I emailed the hotel and to date (a week later) have not heard back. A disappointing ending to a disappointing stay. I hope that with more comments like these the Triton will take a good, hard look at its management, staff, training, maintenance, etc., and become a better hotel. Until then, Iâ€™ll explore other accommodations the next time Iâ€™m in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Well located Kimpton outlet”
Reviews.Author: optigan
Reviews.Content: Just beside the Chinatown Gate, the Triton is close to Union Square and Market Street, very well placed for transit and shopping, and a good starting point for walks to the Ferry Terminal and SFMoMA. Not much in the way of good and inexpensive food in the neighborhood, so it was good to clear out early to get to more residential neighborhoods. The hotel was clean, with a pleasant staff, and the room was well-appointed, though in the rather silly contemporary style favored by Kimpton hotels. Noise in our court-facing room was minimal, despite construction going on all over the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fgaliber
Reviews.Content: The lobby and guest room were nicely decorated, the bathroom was clean, and the bed was very comfortable. But the guest room was very small (standard queen), the work desk was very awkward, and very few of the power outlets worked. I only stayed one night in the Triton, but for the price, I was very satisfied with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Hotel in a great Location”
Reviews.Author: Vanessacmc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Triton for 4 nights in September. If we ever visited again we would definately stay at the same place. From when we first arrived the hotel staff were exceptionally friendly. Complimentary wine is served from 5-6pm. Unfortunately we arrived just after 6, however the staff at the front desk insisted that they get me a glass of wine after our long journey. A perfect start to the holiday! Yes, the rooms and bathrooms are on the small side, but the hotel makes up for this by just being 'different'. The lifts, decor, lobby etc are all interesting and whether it is to your taste or not, it does make a change to the regular hotel look! The hotel is in a great location, just a couple of minutes walk to Union Sq. Contrary to what other people have said we found the hotel to be quiet. Other good points; free internet access, a nice warming fire in the lobby, afternoon cookies at 3pm, coffee served in the lobby in the morning and good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Cafe being renovated”
Reviews.Author: uxj
Reviews.Content: Contrary to other comments below, I liked the hotel. Yes the rooms are small, but who wants to stay in the room in a city like S.F.? They were clean (no smells), practical and had everything you need + style! Service was very friendly and helpful, so the only drawback end of August was that their Cafe was not available during renovation. Ask if it's open again if you like to have breakfast in the hotel. It's worth booking well in advance, because rates did go up when I checked them later. Booking through their website is convenient - and does allow later changes or cancellations, if your plans change.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Triton! Excellent Location, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: shazqazi
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Trition from September 1st to September 5th and really enjoyed it. The hotel is in a excellent location and walking distance to almost any of the attractions that a tourist may want to see (chinatown, union square, fisherman's wharf etc.) It is also a short walk to the cable car stop located only two blocks from the hotel. My family got a taxi couple of times. The hotel staff was courteous enough to hail a taxi for us. Also, the cafe was closed during our stay but we had easy access to some very nice breakfast places. POSH BAGELS and FRANCISCAN CROSSIANTS were right around the corner and so is Starbucks. There is also Walgreens and 7-eleven right near the hotel. So, it worked perfectly for us. I booked this hotel on priceline for $80 a night. I got two Zenden rooms which only has a single bed. Upon a few conversations with the staff, I was upgraded to a room with two double beds and one with a king bed without any problems. The rooms had a view of chinatown and did not have any noise issues. Upon reading previous reviews of this hotel, I had requested them not to give me a room that faces the alley and my request was met without any hesitation. The hotel staff had already told me that the rooms were about 14 by 11 in size so the size of the rooms was not a surprise to me. I admit that the rooms could be a little more updated. My only complain is that the bathrooms do not have an exhaust. Overall, my stay was very pleasant. The staff was helpful and informative and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Am I missing something???”
Reviews.Author: californiainuk
Reviews.Content: Booked this through hotwire at $125 a night. The staff were very friendly, though inexperienced (our first room had other guests luggage in it, the second room we opened to guests being in the room, the third room was fine). This hotel was very dated and shabby, and the room was uncomfortably tiny. Also, the Cafe De Presse was being renovated RIGHT BELOW US so all day from 8 in the morning until 6 at night all we heard was banging and loud construction noise (even on the weekend!). PArking was a rip off at $37 plus tax, and it took nearly 20 minutes for the valet to get our car once we were ready to check out. Would not stay here again at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Too tiny, too funky”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
